item.title: Chapter 1: How We Got the Book of Mormon
item.description: Joseph Smith sees a vision of God and Jesus Christ. An angel, Moroni, instructs him and shows him where to find an ancient record. Joseph translates the record by the power of God.

item.title: Chapter 2: Lehi Warns the People
item.description: Lehi warns the people of Jerusalem to repent or they will soon be destroyed. The people are angry with Lehi and try to kill him.

item.title: Chapter 3: Lehi Leaves Jerusalem
item.description: The Lord warns Lehi to flee with his family into the wilderness. Lehi's son, Nephi, prays and believes his father's words but his two other brothers, Laman and Lemuel, rebel.

item.title: Chapter 4: The Brass Plates
item.description: Lehi sends his sons back to Jerusalem to get the brass plates from King Laban. After many attempts they are able to get the plates and, Zoram, one of Laban's servants, comes with them.

item.title: Chapter 5: Traveling in the Wilderness
item.description: Ishmael and his family join Lehi's family in the wilderness. The sons of Lehi marry the daughters of Ishmael. They have many trials in the wilderness, and some of them rebel. They reach the seashore and name the land Bountiful.

item.title: Chapter 6: Lehi’s Dream
item.description: Lehi shares a dream he had with his family. In his dream he saw a tree with fruit that would make you happy. Various groups of people either partake of the fruit, get lost on their way to the tree, or mock those who partake of the fruit.

item.title: Chapter 7: Building the Ship
item.description: The Lord instructs Nephi to build a ship and reveals to Nephi the design and method for making the ship. Laman and Lemuel mock Nephi for attempting to build a ship.

item.title: Chapter 8: Crossing the Sea
item.description: Lehi and his family set off in the ship for the promised land. Laman and Lemuel become angry and tie Nephi up with ropes. A storm arises and does not subside until Laman and Lemuel untie Nephi.

item.title: Chapter 9: A New Home in the Promised Land
item.description: Lehi and his family arrive in the promised land. The Lord commands Nephi to keep a record. After Lehi dies, Laman and Lemuel rebel and their families separate themselves from those who follow Nephi.

item.title: Chapter 10: Jacob and Sherem
item.description: Nephi dies, and his brother Jacob becomes the leader. A wicked man named Sherem tells people not to believe in Christ. Jacob speaks with Sherem, ands after a sign from God, Sherem repents and tells the people to believe in Christ.

item.title: Chapter 11: Enos
item.description: Jacob's son Enos prays all day and into the night, and his sins are forgiven. He prays for the Nephites and the Lamanites. Enos spends the rest of his life serving God and teaching people the gospel.

item.title: Chapter 12: King Benjamin
item.description: King Benjamin addresses his people and prophesies about the life of Jesus Christ. The people believe his teachings and covenant to keep the commandments. King Benjamin's son Mosiah is appointed to be the next king.

item.title: Chapter 13: Zeniff
item.description: The Lamanites allow Zeniff and his people to live in their land. The Lamanites agree to not attack, but they do not honor their promise. The Nephites pray for strength. They are able to defeat the Lamanites for two generations.

item.title: Chapter 14: Abinadi and King Noah
item.description: Abinadi teaches wicked King Noah and his priests. King Noah becomes angry and has Abinadi killed. Alma, one of King Noah’s priests, believes Abinadi and flees.

item.title: Chapter 15: Alma Teaches and Baptizes
item.description: Alma writes down the words of Abinadi and preaches the gospel to the Nephites. Many people follow him and are baptized. The army of King Noah comes looking for them, but they escape and establish a righteous civilization.

item.title: Chapter 16: King Limhi and His People Escape
item.description: Limhi becomes the king of the Nephites who were captured by the Lamanites. Ammon and other Nephites arrive from Zarahemla and help King Limhi's people to escape and return to Zarahemla.

item.title: Chapter 17: Alma and His People Escape
item.description: Lamanites take over the land of Alma and his people. They pray to God to be freed. God strengthens them and prepares a way for them to escape. They make it to Zarahemla and are welcomed by King Mosiah and his people.

item.title: Chapter 18: Alma the Younger Repents
item.description: Alma becomes the leader of the Church. His son Alma the Younger and the sons of Mosiah persecute the followers of Christ. An angel appears to them and calls them to repentance. They repent and try to repair the evil they did.

item.title: Chapter 19: The Sons of Mosiah Become Missionaries
item.description: The four sons of Mosiah desire to preach the gospel among the Lamanites. They all refuse to be king. King Mosiah prays, and the Lord tells him to let his sons go. They fast and pray that they will be good missionaries.

item.title: Chapter 20: Alma and Nehor
item.description: Alma the Younger becomes the first chief judge. A wicked man named Nehor leads many away with his lies and kills Gideon. Nehor is put to death, but many still believe his words. Those who continue to follow God and care for the poor are blessed.

item.title: Chapter 21: The Amlicites
item.description: Amlici, a wicked Nephite, wants to become king, and many follow him. The people vote, and he is not made king. He and his followers fight against the righteous Nephites. The Nephites are blessed with strength and defeat the Amlicites.

item.title: Chapter 22: Alma’s Mission to Ammonihah
item.description: Alma steps down as chief judge to spread the gospel. Alma finds Amulek, and they preach together. Zeezrom tries to confound them but is unable to do so. Zeezrom and others repent and are baptized. The believers are persecuted.

item.title: Chapter 23: Ammon: A Great Servant
item.description: Ammon becomes a servant of King Lamoni. He defends the king’s flock from a band of robbers. King Lamoni is impressed with Ammon’s faithfulness. Ammon teaches King Lamoni, and he is converted.

item.title: Chapter 24: Ammon Meets King Lamoni’s Father
item.description: Ammon and King Lamoni go to rescue Aaron out of prison. They meet King Lamoni’s father on the way. At first, his father is very angry, but his heart is softened and he helps free Aaron from prison.

item.title: Chapter 25: Aaron Teaches King Lamoni’s Father
item.description: Aaron goes to the land of King Lamoni's father and teaches him the gospel. He is converted, and many believe him.

item.title: Chapter 26: The People of Ammon
item.description: The sons of Mosiah teach many Lamanites who repent and join the Church. They become known as the Anti-Nephi-Lehies. They are hard-working people who make a promise to God that they will never kill again.

item.title: Chapter 27: Korihor
item.description: Korihor preaches wickedness. Many people believe Korihor and are led astray. He demands a sign from Alma. Korihor is struck dumb by the Lord.

item.title: Chapter 28: The Zoramites and the Rameumptom
item.description: Alma and Amulek find success among the poor Zoramites. They teach them about faith, Jesus Christ, and God's plan for His children.

item.title: Chapter 29: Alma Teaches about Faith and the Word of God
item.description: Alma teaches the Zoramites about faith. He says that faith is believing something that is true but that cannot be seen. He teaches that if you continue to study the gospel, your faith will become stronger.

item.title: Chapter 30: Alma Counsels His Sons
item.description: Alma counsels with his three sons. He commends Helaman and Shiblon for their faith, but he chastises Corianton for breaking the commandments and setting a bad example for the Zoramites. Alma and his sons continue to preach the gospel.

item.title: Chapter 31: Captain Moroni Defeats Zerahemnah
item.description: Zerahemnah, the leader of the Lamanites, brings his army to fight the Nephites. Captain Moroni's army is well prepared and battle against the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 32: Captain Moroni and the Title of Liberty
item.description: A wicked man named Amalickiah wants to be king over the Nephites. Many Nephites leave the Church and follow him. Captain Moroni erects the title of liberty and encourages the Nephites to protect their freedom.

item.title: Chapter 33: King-Men versus Freemen
item.description: The Nephites in favor of a king refuse to help fight with Captain Moroni against the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 34: Helaman and the 2,000 Young Warriors
item.description: The Nephite leaders don't want the people of Ammon to break their promise and help fight against the Lamanites. Their sons decide to fight. Helaman leads the 2,000 sons to battle. None are killed, because of their great faith.

item.title: Chapter 35: Captain Moroni and Pahoran
item.description: Chapter 35: Captain Moroni and Pahoran Captain Moroni writes to Pahoran asking for more soldiers and supplies to help Helaman and his army. Pahoran is unable to send help, however, because a group of wicked Nephites has joined with the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 36: Hagoth
item.description: Hagoth and a group of Nephites leave Zarahemla and travel north. They built ships and set sail. They took food and supplies and were never heard from again.

item.title: Chapter 37: Nephi and Lehi in Prison
item.description: Nephi and Lehi, the sons of Helaman, preach the gospel among the Lamanites. They are thrown into prison but escape by a ring of fire.

item.title: Chapter 38: The Murder of the Chief Judge
item.description: Nephi prophesies about the chief judge’s murder. Many people are convinced that Nephi is a prophet.

item.title: Chapter 39: Nephi Receives Great Power
item.description: Nephi is saddened by the wickedness of the Nephites. He prays for a famine to humble them.

item.title: Chapter 40: Samuel the Lamanite Tells about Jesus Christ
item.description: The Lord sends Samuel, a Lamanite prophet, among the Nephites. He prophesies of the signs of Christ’s birth and death.

item.title: Chapter 41: The Signs of Christ’s Birth
item.description: The unbelieving Nephites appoint a day when they will kill the believers if the sign of Christ’s birth has not appeared. Nephi, the son of Nephi, prays in behalf of the believers. The Lord comforts Nephi, and the sign appears the next day.

item.title: Chapter 42: The Signs of Christ’s Crucifixion
item.description: Great storms, thunderings, and earthquakes arise after the death of Christ. There is darkness for three days, and out of the darkness the survivors hear the voice of Jesus Christ calling them to repentance.

item.title: Chapter 43: Jesus Christ Appears to the Nephites
item.description: Christ descends out of heaven. He speaks to the people gathered at the temple and teaches them about baptism. He calls Twelve Apostles .

item.title: Chapter 44: Jesus Christ Blesses the Children
item.description: Christ tells the Nephites to bring their children to him. He offers a prayer that is so marvelous that the words of it could not be written. Christ blesses the children one by one, and they are surrounded and ministered to by angels from heaven.

item.title: Chapter 45: Jesus Christ Teaches about the Sacrament and Prayer
item.description: Christ demonstrates and explains the sacrament. He teaches the people to pray always in his name. He gives the twelve disciples the power to give others the Holy Ghost. The disciples witness Christ ascending to heaven.

item.title: Chapter 46: Jesus Christ Teaches and Prays with the Nephites
item.description: Angels minister to those who were baptized, and Christ appears again. Christ prays to Heavenly Father. He gives the people the sacrament. After Jesus returns to heaven, his disciples teach and baptize many more people.

item.title: Chapter 47: Jesus Christ Blesses His Disciples
item.description: Christ comes to the twelve disciples when they are fasting and praying. He teaches them the gospel and tells them to write down his words. He promises each of the Twelve distinct blessings.

item.title: Chapter 48: Peace in America
item.description: After Jesus returns to live with Heavenly Father, the people are blessed. Many more people are baptized, and there is peace in the land.

item.title: Chapter 49: Mormon and His Teachings
item.description: Many years after Jesus visited the Nephites, Mormon becomes responsible for the sacred records of the people. The people are very wicked. Mormon leads the people into battle, but because of their wickedness, all people are destroyed.

item.title: Chapter 50: The Jaredites Leave Babel
item.description: During the destruction of the Tower of Babel, the Lord spares the languages of Jared’s family. They gather supplies and go where the Lord directs.

item.title: Chapter 51: The Jaredites Travel to the Promised Land
item.description: The Jaredites build barges according to the Lord’s instructions. The brother of Jared asks the Lord to touch stones to provide light in the barges. He sees the Lord. The Jaredites travel to the promised land.

item.title: Chapter 52: The Destruction of the Jaredites
item.description: The wicked Jaredites try to kill the prophets and have many wars. The prophet Ether warns the wicked King Coriantumr about the destruction of his people. Eventually, all people are destroyed. Ether records the history of the Jaredites.

item.title: Chapter 53: Moroni and His Teachings
item.description: After Mormon dies, Moroni writes important doctrine about the sacrament, baptism, and the Savior. The wicked Lamanites kill Nephites who would not deny Jesus Christ. Moroni knew he would return to live with Heavenly Father when he died.

item.title: Chapter 54: The Promise of the Book of Mormon
item.description: Before Moroni buried the plates, he wrote a promise that if people would ask sincerely if the records were true, the Holy Ghost would testify of the truth. He hid the plates in the Hill Cumorah.

item.title: Becoming Children of Christ
item.description: Two young women learn what it means to put off the natural man and become children of Christ.

item.title: Can You Imagine?
item.description: A young man's alter ego uses a courtroom setting to explore what it would be like to stand before God on Judgment Day.

item.title: Firm in the Faith of Christ
item.description: A grandfather uses Captain Moroni as an example of a true hero for his grandson. Moroni's faith and loyalty to the Savior provide an example all Saints should follow.

item.title: I Will Prepare the Way
item.description: The support and direction the Lord gave to Nephi when he was commanded to build a ship serves as a model for a young woman as she faces an overwhelming task of her own.

item.title: O Ye Fair Ones
item.description: As Mormon and his son Moroni behold the hundreds of thousands of Nephites slain in the last battle with the Lamanites, Mormon laments, "O ye fair ones, how could ye have departed from the ways of the Lord!"

item.title: The Mediator
item.description: A portrayal of the analogy Elder Boyd K. Packer used in his April 1977 general conference address. A young man who fails to pay a debt is saved from the grasp of justice through the mediation of a friend.

item.title: The Pride Cycle
item.description: An illustration of the great pride of the people of Zarahemla about twenty years before the birth of the Savior. The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people's wickedness.

item.title: My Joy is Full
item.description: Visual and music highlight this portrayal of the Savior's visit to the inhabitants of ancient America, providing a unique view of His caring, compassion, and love for His children.

item.title: For Our Day
item.description: Latter-day Saint youth from around the world describe the influence and guidance the Book of Mormon provides in their lives.

item.title: Be Still, and Know That I Am God
item.description: May 4, 2014: Elder M. Russell Ballard

item.title: Tuning Our Hearts to the Voice of the Spirit
item.description: March 2, 2014: Sister Linda K. Burton shares insights to help increase the listener’s ability to recognize the voice of the spirit.

item.title: What Is the Blueprint of Christ’s Church
item.description: January 12, 2014: Elder Tad R. Callister explains the spiritual blueprint the Lord used to build His church in order to best accommodate the spiritual needs of his children.

item.title: I Will Give Myself to Him
item.description: November 3, 2013: Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe teaches young adults principles of controlling the natural man and giving themselves to the Lord.

item.title: Youth of the Noble Birthright: What Will You Choose?
item.description: September 8, 2013: Elder Russell M. Nelson teaches that the youth of the Church are to be standard bearers of the Lord, and beacons of light to attract others to Him.

item.title: Our Prophet: Thomas S. Monson
item.description: May 5, 2013: Elder William R. Walker speaks of five ways individuals can follow the life and teachings of President Thomas S. Monson.

item.title: That We Might “Not . . . Shrink” (Doctrine and Covenants 19:18)
item.description: March 3, 2013: Elder David A. Bednar speaks on steadfastness and submission to the Lord's will.

item.title: What Is Truth?
item.description: January 13, 2013: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf shares how to recognize light and truth in our lives and how to react properly to it.

item.title: We Are the Architects of Our Own Happiness
item.description: November 2012: Bishop Gérald Caussé speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: Israel, Israel, God is Calling
item.description: September 2012: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: Stand in the Sacred Grove
item.description: May 6, 2012: Elder Marlin K. Jensen speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: What E're Thou Art, Act Well Thy Part
item.description: March 4, 2012: Elder Quentin L. Cook speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: The Unspeakable Gift of the Holy Ghost
item.description: January 8, 2012: Elder Jay E. Jensen speaks at a CES Devotional for young adults.

item.title: Truths Most Worth Knowing
item.description: November 6, 2011: President Boyd K. Packer speaks at the CES Devotional.

item.title: Truth and Tolerance
item.description: September 11, 2011: Elder Dallin H. Oaks speaks at the CES Devotional.

item.title: Coming to Know
item.description: May 1, 2011: Sister Rosemary M. Wixom addresses young adults and outlines four questions that will help individuals come to the knowledge of their Redeemer.

item.title: We Were the Greatest Generation
item.description: March 6, 2011: Elder L. Tom Perry encourages young adults to become the greatest generation by helping others return to their Christian faith.

item.title: Give Us This Day Our Daily Bread
item.description: January 9, 2011: Elder Christofferson instructs young adults about the importance of seeking God daily and trusting Him to provide.

item.title: Follow the Doctrine and Gospel of Christ
item.description: November 7, 2010: Elder M. Russell Ballard teaches how to remain clean from the world through obedience to the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Thy Friends Do Stand by Thee
item.description: March 7, 2010: Elder Ronald A. Rasband shares the importance of making and keeping righteous friendships as we grow together in the gospel.

item.title: Things as They Really Are
item.description: May 3, 2009: Elder David A. Bednar warns of the effect of using too much technology and taking for granted our physical bodies.

item.title: Seek and Attain the Spiritual High Ground in Life
item.description: March 1, 2009: Elder Hales teaches how to rise above worldly temptations and seek the spiritual high ground using the story of Lehonti from the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Great Expectations
item.description: January 11, 2009: President Thomas S. Monson speaks of the importance of four critical steps to achieve success in the race of life.

item.title: Chapter 1: How We Got the Book of Mormon
item.description: Joseph Smith sees a vision of God and Jesus Christ. An angel, Moroni, instructs him and shows him where to find an ancient record. Joseph translates the record by the power of God.

item.title: Chapter 2: Lehi Warns the People
item.description: Lehi warns the people of Jerusalem to repent or they will soon be destroyed. The people are angry with Lehi and try to kill him.

item.title: Chapter 3: Lehi Leaves Jerusalem
item.description: The Lord warns Lehi to flee with his family into the wilderness. Lehi's son, Nephi, prays and believes his father's words but his two other brothers, Laman and Lemuel, rebel.

item.title: Chapter 4: The Brass Plates
item.description: Lehi sends his sons back to Jerusalem to get the brass plates from King Laban. After many attempts they are able to get the plates and, Zoram, one of Laban's servants, comes with them.

item.title: Chapter 5: Traveling in the Wilderness
item.description: Ishmael and his family join Lehi's family in the wilderness. The sons of Lehi marry the daughters of Ishmael. They have many trials in the wilderness, and some of them rebel. They reach the seashore and name the land Bountiful.

item.title: Chapter 6: Lehi’s Dream
item.description: Lehi shares a dream he had with his family. In his dream he saw a tree with fruit that would make you happy. Various groups of people either partake of the fruit, get lost on their way to the tree, or mock those who partake of the fruit.

item.title: Chapter 7: Building the Ship
item.description: The Lord instructs Nephi to build a ship and reveals to Nephi the design and method for making the ship. Laman and Lemuel mock Nephi for attempting to build a ship.

item.title: Chapter 8: Crossing the Sea
item.description: Lehi and his family set off in the ship for the promised land. Laman and Lemuel become angry and tie Nephi up with ropes. A storm arises and does not subside until Laman and Lemuel untie Nephi.

item.title: Chapter 9: A New Home in the Promised Land
item.description: Lehi and his family arrive in the promised land. The Lord commands Nephi to keep a record. After Lehi dies, Laman and Lemuel rebel and their families separate themselves from those who follow Nephi.

item.title: Chapter 10: Jacob and Sherem
item.description: Nephi dies, and his brother Jacob becomes the leader. A wicked man named Sherem tells people not to believe in Christ. Jacob speaks with Sherem, ands after a sign from God, Sherem repents and tells the people to believe in Christ.

item.title: Chapter 11: Enos
item.description: Jacob's son Enos prays all day and into the night, and his sins are forgiven. He prays for the Nephites and the Lamanites. Enos spends the rest of his life serving God and teaching people the gospel.

item.title: Chapter 12: King Benjamin
item.description: King Benjamin addresses his people and prophesies about the life of Jesus Christ. The people believe his teachings and covenant to keep the commandments. King Benjamin's son Mosiah is appointed to be the next king.

item.title: Chapter 13: Zeniff
item.description: The Lamanites allow Zeniff and his people to live in their land. The Lamanites agree to not attack, but they do not honor their promise. The Nephites pray for strength. They are able to defeat the Lamanites for two generations.

item.title: Chapter 14: Abinadi and King Noah
item.description: Abinadi teaches wicked King Noah and his priests. King Noah becomes angry and has Abinadi killed. Alma, one of King Noah’s priests, believes Abinadi and flees.

item.title: Chapter 15: Alma Teaches and Baptizes
item.description: Alma writes down the words of Abinadi and preaches the gospel to the Nephites. Many people follow him and are baptized. The army of King Noah comes looking for them, but they escape and establish a righteous civilization.

item.title: Chapter 16: King Limhi and His People Escape
item.description: Limhi becomes the king of the Nephites who were captured by the Lamanites. Ammon and other Nephites arrive from Zarahemla and help King Limhi's people to escape and return to Zarahemla.

item.title: Chapter 17: Alma and His People Escape
item.description: Lamanites take over the land of Alma and his people. They pray to God to be freed. God strengthens them and prepares a way for them to escape. They make it to Zarahemla and are welcomed by King Mosiah and his people.

item.title: Chapter 18: Alma the Younger Repents
item.description: Alma becomes the leader of the Church. His son Alma the Younger and the sons of Mosiah persecute the followers of Christ. An angel appears to them and calls them to repentance. They repent and try to repair the evil they did.

item.title: Chapter 19: The Sons of Mosiah Become Missionaries
item.description: The four sons of Mosiah desire to preach the gospel among the Lamanites. They all refuse to be king. King Mosiah prays, and the Lord tells him to let his sons go. They fast and pray that they will be good missionaries.

item.title: Chapter 20: Alma and Nehor
item.description: Alma the Younger becomes the first chief judge. A wicked man named Nehor leads many away with his lies and kills Gideon. Nehor is put to death, but many still believe his words. Those who continue to follow God and care for the poor are blessed.

item.title: Chapter 21: The Amlicites
item.description: Amlici, a wicked Nephite, wants to become king, and many follow him. The people vote, and he is not made king. He and his followers fight against the righteous Nephites. The Nephites are blessed with strength and defeat the Amlicites.

item.title: Chapter 22: Alma’s Mission to Ammonihah
item.description: Alma steps down as chief judge to spread the gospel. Alma finds Amulek, and they preach together. Zeezrom tries to confound them but is unable to do so. Zeezrom and others repent and are baptized. The believers are persecuted.

item.title: Chapter 23: Ammon: A Great Servant
item.description: Ammon becomes a servant of King Lamoni. He defends the king’s flock from a band of robbers. King Lamoni is impressed with Ammon’s faithfulness. Ammon teaches King Lamoni, and he is converted.

item.title: Chapter 24: Ammon Meets King Lamoni’s Father
item.description: Ammon and King Lamoni go to rescue Aaron out of prison. They meet King Lamoni’s father on the way. At first, his father is very angry, but his heart is softened and he helps free Aaron from prison.

item.title: Chapter 25: Aaron Teaches King Lamoni’s Father
item.description: Aaron goes to the land of King Lamoni's father and teaches him the gospel. He is converted, and many believe him.

item.title: Chapter 26: The People of Ammon
item.description: The sons of Mosiah teach many Lamanites who repent and join the Church. They become known as the Anti-Nephi-Lehies. They are hard-working people who make a promise to God that they will never kill again.

item.title: Chapter 27: Korihor
item.description: Korihor preaches wickedness. Many people believe Korihor and are led astray. He demands a sign from Alma. Korihor is struck dumb by the Lord.

item.title: Chapter 28: The Zoramites and the Rameumptom
item.description: Alma and Amulek find success among the poor Zoramites. They teach them about faith, Jesus Christ, and God's plan for His children.

item.title: Chapter 29: Alma Teaches about Faith and the Word of God
item.description: Alma teaches the Zoramites about faith. He says that faith is believing something that is true but that cannot be seen. He teaches that if you continue to study the gospel, your faith will become stronger.

item.title: Chapter 30: Alma Counsels His Sons
item.description: Alma counsels with his three sons. He commends Helaman and Shiblon for their faith, but he chastises Corianton for breaking the commandments and setting a bad example for the Zoramites. Alma and his sons continue to preach the gospel.

item.title: Chapter 31: Captain Moroni Defeats Zerahemnah
item.description: Zerahemnah, the leader of the Lamanites, brings his army to fight the Nephites. Captain Moroni's army is well prepared and battle against the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 32: Captain Moroni and the Title of Liberty
item.description: A wicked man named Amalickiah wants to be king over the Nephites. Many Nephites leave the Church and follow him. Captain Moroni erects the title of liberty and encourages the Nephites to protect their freedom.

item.title: Chapter 33: King-Men versus Freemen
item.description: The Nephites in favor of a king refuse to help fight with Captain Moroni against the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 34: Helaman and the 2,000 Young Warriors
item.description: The Nephite leaders don't want the people of Ammon to break their promise and help fight against the Lamanites. Their sons decide to fight. Helaman leads the 2,000 sons to battle. None are killed, because of their great faith.

item.title: Chapter 35: Captain Moroni and Pahoran
item.description: Chapter 35: Captain Moroni and Pahoran Captain Moroni writes to Pahoran asking for more soldiers and supplies to help Helaman and his army. Pahoran is unable to send help, however, because a group of wicked Nephites has joined with the Lamanites.

item.title: Chapter 36: Hagoth
item.description: Hagoth and a group of Nephites leave Zarahemla and travel north. They built ships and set sail. They took food and supplies and were never heard from again.

item.title: Chapter 37: Nephi and Lehi in Prison
item.description: Nephi and Lehi, the sons of Helaman, preach the gospel among the Lamanites. They are thrown into prison but escape by a ring of fire.

item.title: Chapter 38: The Murder of the Chief Judge
item.description: Nephi prophesies about the chief judge’s murder. Many people are convinced that Nephi is a prophet.

item.title: Chapter 39: Nephi Receives Great Power
item.description: Nephi is saddened by the wickedness of the Nephites. He prays for a famine to humble them.

item.title: Chapter 40: Samuel the Lamanite Tells about Jesus Christ
item.description: The Lord sends Samuel, a Lamanite prophet, among the Nephites. He prophesies of the signs of Christ’s birth and death.

item.title: Chapter 41: The Signs of Christ’s Birth
item.description: The unbelieving Nephites appoint a day when they will kill the believers if the sign of Christ’s birth has not appeared. Nephi, the son of Nephi, prays in behalf of the believers. The Lord comforts Nephi, and the sign appears the next day.

item.title: Chapter 42: The Signs of Christ’s Crucifixion
item.description: Great storms, thunderings, and earthquakes arise after the death of Christ. There is darkness for three days, and out of the darkness the survivors hear the voice of Jesus Christ calling them to repentance.

item.title: Chapter 43: Jesus Christ Appears to the Nephites
item.description: Christ descends out of heaven. He speaks to the people gathered at the temple and teaches them about baptism. He calls Twelve Apostles .

item.title: Chapter 44: Jesus Christ Blesses the Children
item.description: Christ tells the Nephites to bring their children to him. He offers a prayer that is so marvelous that the words of it could not be written. Christ blesses the children one by one, and they are surrounded and ministered to by angels from heaven.

item.title: Chapter 45: Jesus Christ Teaches about the Sacrament and Prayer
item.description: Christ demonstrates and explains the sacrament. He teaches the people to pray always in his name. He gives the twelve disciples the power to give others the Holy Ghost. The disciples witness Christ ascending to heaven.

item.title: Chapter 46: Jesus Christ Teaches and Prays with the Nephites
item.description: Angels minister to those who were baptized, and Christ appears again. Christ prays to Heavenly Father. He gives the people the sacrament. After Jesus returns to heaven, his disciples teach and baptize many more people.

item.title: Chapter 47: Jesus Christ Blesses His Disciples
item.description: Christ comes to the twelve disciples when they are fasting and praying. He teaches them the gospel and tells them to write down his words. He promises each of the Twelve distinct blessings.

item.title: Chapter 48: Peace in America
item.description: After Jesus returns to live with Heavenly Father, the people are blessed. Many more people are baptized, and there is peace in the land.

item.title: Chapter 49: Mormon and His Teachings
item.description: Many years after Jesus visited the Nephites, Mormon becomes responsible for the sacred records of the people. The people are very wicked. Mormon leads the people into battle, but because of their wickedness, all people are destroyed.

item.title: Chapter 50: The Jaredites Leave Babel
item.description: During the destruction of the Tower of Babel, the Lord spares the languages of Jared’s family. They gather supplies and go where the Lord directs.

item.title: Chapter 51: The Jaredites Travel to the Promised Land
item.description: The Jaredites build barges according to the Lord’s instructions. The brother of Jared asks the Lord to touch stones to provide light in the barges. He sees the Lord. The Jaredites travel to the promised land.

item.title: Chapter 52: The Destruction of the Jaredites
item.description: The wicked Jaredites try to kill the prophets and have many wars. The prophet Ether warns the wicked King Coriantumr about the destruction of his people. Eventually, all people are destroyed. Ether records the history of the Jaredites.

item.title: Chapter 53: Moroni and His Teachings
item.description: After Mormon dies, Moroni writes important doctrine about the sacrament, baptism, and the Savior. The wicked Lamanites kill Nephites who would not deny Jesus Christ. Moroni knew he would return to live with Heavenly Father when he died.

item.title: Chapter 54: The Promise of the Book of Mormon
item.description: Before Moroni buried the plates, he wrote a promise that if people would ask sincerely if the records were true, the Holy Ghost would testify of the truth. He hid the plates in the Hill Cumorah.

item.title: Introduction: Before the Doctrine and Covenants
item.description: The plan of salvation provides a way for God's children to return to live with Him. We learn about this plan through the words of Christ and His prophets.

item.title: Chapter 1: Joseph Smith and His Family (1805–1820)
item.description: Joseph Smith's family is hardworking, loving, and full of faith. Joseph has an injured leg and has surgery without pain medication.

item.title: Chapter 2: Joseph Smith’s First Vision (1820)
item.description: Joseph prays to know which church to join. Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ appear to him and tell him that none of the churches are true.

item.title: Chapter 3: The Angel Moroni and the Gold Plates (1823–1827)
item.description: The angel Moroni appears to Joseph Smith and tells him about the Book of Mormon written on gold plates in the Hill Cumorah.

item.title: Chapter 4: Martin Harris and the Lost Pages (1827–1828)
item.description: Martin Harris desires to show 116 translated pages of the Book of Mormon to his family and others.

item.title: Chapter 5: Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery (February–April 1829)
item.description: Oliver Cowdery helps Joseph Smith translate the Book of Mormon. The Lord reveals many commandments.

item.title: Chapter 6: Joseph and Oliver Are Given the Priesthood: May 1829
item.description: Joseph and Oliver have questions about baptism. John the Baptist appears and gives the Aaronic Priesthood to them. They are both baptized.

item.title: Chapter 7: Witnesses See the Gold Plates (1829–1830)
item.description: Selected witnesses see the gold plates and testify that the plates are real.

item.title: Chapter 8: Getting Ready for the Church of Jesus Christ (April 1830)
item.description: Joseph receives a revelation about how to organize the true Church. He also learns more about Jesus Christ.

item.title: Chapter 9: Organization of the Church of Jesus Christ (6 April 1830)
item.description: While in New York, Joseph Smith organizes The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Chapter 10: The First Miracle in the Church (April 1830)
item.description: Oliver Cowdery teaches and baptizes many people. Newel Knight's testimony is strengthened after trials.

item.title: Chapter 11: More People Join the Church: April-June 1830
item.description: Many people learn about the Church and are baptized. Wicked men try to prevent the work from progressing, but the Lord protects His people.

item.title: Chapter 12: Samuel Smith's Mission (June 1830)
item.description: Samuel Smith, the first missionary for the Church, teaches people but has very little success. Many people, like Brigham Young, were converted later because of his efforts.

item.title: Chapter 13: Joseph and Emma (July 1830)
item.description: Joseph and Emma sacrifice much to spread the gospel. They rely on the Lord. Jesus tells Emma what she is supposed to do.

item.title: Chapter 14: The Prophet and Revelations for the Church (September 1830)
item.description: Only one man can receive revelation for the entire Church. Hyrum Page receives false revelations through a stone. He listens to the prophet and repents.

item.title: Chapter 15: A Mission to the Lamanites (September 1830)
item.description: Many Saints go on missions to the American Indians.

item.title: Chapter 16: Joseph Smith and Sidney Rigdon Learn about Zion (1830)
item.description: Sidney Rigdon is baptized and leads many to Christ. Through the Lord's help, Joseph and Sidney reveal some of the missing doctrine in the Bible.

item.title: Chapter 17: The First Bishops of the Church (February and December 1831)
item.description: Bishops are called to help teach, love, and help the Saints.

item.title: Chapter 18: The Law of the Church (9 February 1831)
item.description: The Law of the Church: 9 February 1831

item.title: Chapter 19: The Second Coming of Jesus Christ
item.description: Some people persecute the Saints of God in the last days. There are many signs to help prepare people for the Second Coming. The Lord will come again as the prophets have testified.

item.title: Chapter 20: Gifts of the Spirit (8 March 1831)
item.description: Through the power of the Holy Ghost, the Lord gives gifts of the Spirit to help others.

item.title: Chapter 21: A Revelation to Settle in Missouri (May–June 1831)
item.description: The Lord tells Joseph to lead the people to Missouri to build the city of Zion.

item.title: Chapter 22: Saints Begin to Settle in Missouri (July–August 1831)
item.description: The Saints arrive in Missouri and begin to build the city of Zion in Independence in Jackson County.

item.title: Chapter 23: The Doctrine and Covenants (August–November 1831)
item.description: The Lord tells Joseph to publish the revelations of the Lord. This book is called the Doctrine and Covenants.

item.title: Chapter 24: Parents Should Teach Their Children (November 1831)
item.description: Parents should teach the gospel of Jesus Christ to their children.

item.title: Chapter 25: Joseph Smith and Sidney Rigdon Go on a Mission (December 1831–January 1832)
item.description: Joseph Smith and Sidney Rigdon go to many towns and declare the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Chapter 26: The Three Kingdoms of Heaven (16 February 1832)
item.description: Heavenly Father reveals to Joseph Smith and Sidney Rigdon the places where people go after they are resurrected, called the three kingdoms of glory.

item.title: Chapter 27: The Prophet Continues His Work Despite Persecution (March 1832)
item.description: Mobs persecute Joseph Smith, but they cannot stop him from doing the Lord's work.

item.title: Chapter 28: The Prophet Joseph Goes to Missouri Again (March–May 1832)
item.description: The Lord gives the Saints in Missouri a revelation about how to take care of others.

item.title: Chapter 29: A Revelation about the Priesthood (September 1832)
item.description: Joseph receives instruction on how to use the power of God.

item.title: Chapter 30: A Revelation about War (25 December 1832)
item.description: The Saints worry about disasters and wars that occur. Jesus reveals a prophecy to Joseph Smith about the Civil War in the United States and diverse wars in the world.

item.title: Chapter 31: The Word of Wisdom (February 1833)
item.description: The Lord reveals to Joseph the Word of Wisdom, a health commandment requiring respect and honor for our bodies. The Lord promises many physical and spiritual blessings for complete obedience.

item.title: Chapter 32: The Church of Jesus Christ in Kirtland: 1833–1834
item.description: The Church's First Presidency, patriarch, and high council were called in Kirtland.

item.title: Chapter 33: A Revelation about Jesus Christ (May 1833)
item.description: Jesus tells about Himself and shows the right way to live.

item.title: Chapter 34: God Warns the People of Zion (July–August 1833)
item.description: God commands more people to move to Missouri. Mobs and evil people persecute the Saints.

item.title: Chapter 35: The Saints Leave Jackson County (Missouri, September–December 1833)
item.description: The governor and judges of Missouri refuse the help the Saints. Due to the persecution from mobs, the Saints leave Missouri.

item.title: Chapter 36: Zion’s Camp (February–June 1834)
item.description: Joseph Smith leads Zion's Camp, a group of men sent to help people in Jackson County.

item.title: Chapter 37: Priesthood Leaders (February–March 1835)
item.description: The Lord calls men to be prophets, apostles, and leaders.

item.title: Chapter 38: The Pearl of Great Price
item.description: The Pearl of Great Price is a book of scripture written by prophets. It contains the Book of Moses, the Book of Abraham, Joseph Smith—Matthew, Joseph Smith— History, and the Articles of Faith.

item.title: Chapter 39: The Kirtland Temple Is Dedicated (January–March 1836)
item.description: Joseph Smith sees a vision of the celestial kingdom. Many Saints come to the dedication of the Kirtland Temple, and angels appear.

item.title: Chapter 40: Visions in the Kirtland Temple (April 1836)
item.description: Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery see Jesus Christ, Moses, Elias, and Elijah and receive sacred priesthood power and keys.

item.title: Chapter 41: Trouble in Kirtland (1837–1838)
item.description: Many Saints have problems with the bank in Kirtland and blame Joseph Smith.

item.title: Chapter 42: Far West, Missouri (January–July 1838)
item.description: Joseph learns where the Lord will come for His Second Coming. Some leaders choose to disobey the prophet.

item.title: Chapter 43: Jesus Christ Names His Church (April 1838)
item.description: Jesus Christ names His church "The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints."

item.title: Chapter 44: Tithing (July 1838)
item.description: The Lord reveals that the Saints should give one-tenth of all they have to the Church.

item.title: Chapter 45: More Mobs in Missouri (1838–1839)
item.description: Mobs do terrible things to the Saints. They hurt and kill many people. Joseph and others are thrown into prison. Joseph silences the jail guards.

item.title: Chapter 46: Joseph Smith in Liberty Jail (November 1838-April 1839)
item.description: Joseph Smith and his friends suffer in Liberty Jail for more than four months. The Lord comforts him.

item.title: Chapter 48: Joseph Smith Asks the President for Help (March–November 1839)
item.description: Joseph Smith instructs the Saints to write down the crimes of those who were persecuting them. Joseph takes those letters to the president of the United States. The president does not help the Saints.

item.title: Chapter 49: Missionaries in Other Lands (June 1837–October 1841)
item.description: The Lord sends missionaries to England and Palestine. They teach the gospel to many people.

item.title: Chapter 50: The Saints in Nauvoo (January–July 1841)
item.description: Joseph Smith receives a revelation to build a temple in Nauvoo. The Lord calls Hyrum Smith to be the Patriarch. Brigham Young learns he is to stay at home with his family.

item.title: Chapter 51: The First Endowments (May 1842)
item.description: The Saints receive a special blessing in the temple called the endowment. They make promises and covenants with God and learn how to return to live with Him.

item.title: Chapter 52: The Relief Society (March 1842)
item.description: The Relief Society, a women's organization, is formed to help and bless the lives of others. The sisters make clothes for the men working at the temple, take care of the sick, and learn about the gospel.

item.title: Chapter 53: Trouble in Nauvoo (May–August 1842)
item.description: John C. Bennett, the mayor of Nauvoo, becomes wicked. Joseph Smith become mayor after conflict with Bennett. Joseph prophesies of future conflicts.

item.title: Chapter 54: God and Angels (February–April 1843)
item.description: Joseph Smith receives a revelation about angels. Heavenly Father and Jesus have a body of flesh and bones. The Holy Ghost is a spirit.

item.title: Chapter 55: A Revelation about Marriage (July 1843)
item.description: Righteous people who are married in the temple can live together forever with God.

item.title: Chapter 56: More Trouble for the Saints (1843–1844)
item.description: Mobs form and persecute the Saints. Enemies start a newspaper with lies about Mormons. Joseph says the Saints will eventually be forced to leave Nauvoo.

item.title: Chapter 57: The Prophet Is Killed (June 1844)
item.description: Although innocent, Joseph, Hyrum, and others go to Carthage Jail. A mob kills Joseph and Hyrum. They give their lives for the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Chapter 58: A New Leader for the Church (July–August 1844)
item.description: The Apostles lead the Church until a new leader is chosen. Sidney Rigdon wants to be the leader and apostatizes.

item.title: Chapter 60: The Saints Leave Nauvoo (September 1845–September 1846)
item.description: The Lord chooses Brigham Young to be the leader after Joseph Smith's death. Mobs drive the Saints out of Nauvoo. The Saints travel in very difficult circumstances.

item.title: Chapter 61: The Mormon Battalion (June 1846–July 1847)
item.description: Brigham Young encourages men to help the United States army in a war against Mexico.

item.title: Chapter 63: The Pioneers Go to the Salt Lake Valley (April–July 1847)
item.description: The pioneers travel from Council Bluffs to the Salt Lake Valley. They set up Winter Quarters. The Lord tells Brigham Young to divide the people into companies.

item.title: Chapter 64: The Saints in the Rocky Mountains (Beginning in July 1847)
item.description: The Saints establish homes in the Salt Lake Valley. They build temples in the West. Many members from distant lands come to be with the Saints.

item.title: Chapter 65: The Church of Jesus Christ Today
item.description: The Church continues to grow with increasing members, missionaries, and temples worldwide.

item.title: Introduction: Our Heavenly Father’s Plan
item.description: Heavenly Father's plan provides everyone a way to return to live with Him through the sacrifice of His son, Jesus Christ. His prophets tell us what we should do.

item.title: Chapter 1: Elisabeth and Zacharias
item.description: An angel tells Zacharias that he and his wife, Elisabeth, will have a son even though they are both very old. Zacharias doesn't believe the angel, so the angel tells him he will not be able to talk until the child is born.

item.title: Chapter 2: Mary and the Angel
item.description: The angel Gabriel comes to Mary and tells her she is to be the mother of the Son of God.

item.title: Chapter 3: John the Baptist Is Born
item.description: Mary goes to visit Elisabeth and the Holy Ghost tells Elisabeth about Mary's baby. Elisabeth's son is born and they name him John as the angel instructed them. Zacharias is able to speak again.

item.title: Chapter 4: Joseph and the Angel
item.description: An angel appears to Joseph in a dream and tells him that Mary's child is the Son of God.

item.title: Chapter 5: Jesus Christ Is Born
item.description: Jesus Christ is born in Bethlehem. Angels tell nearby shepherds of his birth, and they come to worship him.

item.title: Chapter 6: Presentation at the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph bring Jesus to the temple in Jerusalem. Simeon and Anna, two righteous people, see Jesus and praise God.

item.title: Chapter 7: The Wise Men
item.description: Wise men from another land travel to Bethlehem to worship and give gifts to the baby Jesus.

item.title: Chapter 8: Wicked King Herod
item.description: An angel warns Joseph in a dream to take Jesus and Mary to Egypt to escape the wicked King Herod.

item.title: Chapter 9: The Boy Jesus
item.description: The boy Jesus answers the teachers' questions in the temple.

item.title: Chapter 10: Jesus Is Baptized
item.description: John the Baptist prepares the way for Jesus by preaching the gospel and baptizing many people. Jesus comes to John to be baptized and sets the example for all mankind.

item.title: Chapter 11: Jesus Is Tempted
item.description: The devil comes to Jesus as he is fasting and tempts him three times.

item.title: Chapter 12: The Wedding in Cana
item.description: Jesus performs a miracle at a wedding feast in Cana by turning water into wine.

item.title: Chapter 13: Jesus and His Heavenly Father’s House
item.description: Jesus clears the temple of merchants.

item.title: Chapter 14: Nicodemus
item.description: Nicodemus, a Pharisee, comes to talk to Jesus. Jesus tells him that no one can enter heaven without being spiritually born again.

item.title: Chapter 15: The Woman at the Well
item.description: Jesus talks to a Samaritan woman at a well. He tells her about the living water of eternal life, and she tells many people about Jesus's teachings.

item.title: Chapter 16: The Leader’s Son
item.description: Jesus heals the son of a Jewish leader.

item.title: Chapter 17: Angry People in Nazareth
item.description: Jesus tells doubtful, angry Jews in Nazareth that He is the Savior. They try to kill Jesus, but He escapes.

item.title: Chapter 18: Jesus Chooses His Apostles
item.description: Jesus teaches and performs a miracle for a group of fishermen. He tells three of them to follow him and become "fishers of men." He calls and ordains twelve Apostles to preach the gospel and heal people.

item.title: Chapter 19: The Sermon on the Mount
item.description: Jesus gives the Sermon on the Mount. He teaches what we must do to be happy and to return to live with Heavenly Father again.

item.title: Chapter 20: Jesus Teaches about Prayer
item.description: Jesus teaches his disciples that they should pray privately and sincerely. He gives a prayer to show them an example and promises that Heavenly Father will answer their prayers.

item.title: Chapter 21: Jesus Commands the Winds and the Waves
item.description: Jesus calms a storm on the sea, and his disciples marvel that even the wind and sea obey Him.

item.title: Chapter 22: The Man with the Evil Spirits
item.description: Jesus casts evil spirits out of a man. The man believes in Jesus, but others are afraid.

item.title: Chapter 23: The Man Who Could Not Walk
item.description: The friends of a man who cannot walk bring him to see Jesus. Jesus tells the man his sins are forgiven and heals him.

item.title: Chapter 24: Jairus’s Daughter is Raised from the Dead
item.description: A man, Jairus, asks Jesus to come heal his sick daughter. The girl dies before Jesus arrives, but He raises her from the dead.

item.title: Chapter 25: A Woman Touches Jesus’s Clothes
item.description: A faithful woman is healed by simply touching Jesus's clothes.

item.title: Chapter 26: Jesus Forgives a Woman
item.description: A woman with many sins washes Jesus's feet with her hair. A Pharisee criticizes Him, but Jesus tells the Pharisee that the woman's sins are forgiven because of her love for the Savior and her faith.

item.title: Chapter 27: Doing His Father’s Work on Earth
item.description: Jesus heals a man on the Sabbath. This angers many people, but He tells them He was doing what His Father would do.

item.title: Chapter 28: Jesus Feeds 5,000 People
item.description: Jesus miraculously feeds a crowd of 5,000 people.

item.title: Chapter 29: Jesus Walks on the Water
item.description: Jesus walks on water. Peter tries but is afraid and begins to sink. Jesus asks him why he doesn't have more faith.

item.title: Chapter 30: The Bread of Life
item.description: Jesus teaches that He is the Bread of Life. He teaches that if people believe and follow Him they will have everlasting life.

item.title: Chapter 31: Jesus Heals a Deaf Man
item.description: Jesus heals a deaf man, and the people are astonished.

item.title: Chapter 32: Peter Testifies of Christ
item.description: Peter says Jesus is the Son of God. Jesus tells Peter that his testimony has come from God. He tells Peter that he will lead the Church. Jesus tells His disciples that He will suffer, die, and rise on the third day.

item.title: Chapter 33: Appearing in Glory: The Transfiguration
item.description: Jesus is transfigured on a mountaintop. He is visited by Moses and Elias. Peter, James, and John witness Jesus's glory and hear the voice of Heavenly Father testifying of Jesus.

item.title: Chapter 34: The Boy with an Evil Spirit
item.description: Jesus heals a boy who has an evil spirit. The disciples ask why they hadn't been able to heal the same boy, and Jesus tells them that sometimes fasting and prayer is necessary to heal.

item.title: Chapter 35: The Good Samaritan
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the good Samaritan to a Jewish leader to illustrate how we are to love our neighbor as ourselves.

item.title: Chapter 36: Jesus Tells Three Parables
item.description: Jesus tells three parables to illustrate how God feels when sinners repent and return to Him.

item.title: The First Parable: The Lost Sheep
item.description: The shepherd searches for and saves the lost sheep.

item.title: The Second Parable: The Lost Coin
item.description: Jesus teaches about the woman who searches for her lost coin.

item.title: The Third Parable: The Lost Son
item.description: Jesus tells of a son who sins and returns home seeking forgiveness.

item.title: Chapter 37: The Ten Lepers
item.description: Jesus heals ten lepers, but only one of them returns to thank him.

item.title: Chapter 38: The Pharisee and the Publican
item.description: Jesus tells a story about a Pharisee and a publican.

item.title: Chapter 39: Jesus Heals a Blind Man
item.description: Jesus heals a blind man and explains that physical trials do not come as a result of sin.

item.title: Chapter 40: The Good Shepherd
item.description: Jesus calls himself the Good Shepherd and explains that there are other sheep not of this fold.

item.title: Chapter 41: Jesus Blesses the Children
item.description: Jesus blesses the children and tells the disciples that they must become like little children to enter heaven.

item.title: Chapter 42: The Rich Young Man
item.description: Jesus tells a rich young man to sell all of his possessions and give the money to the poor. The rich man loved his riches more than God.

item.title: Chapter 43: Jesus Brings Lazarus Back to Life
item.description: Jesus raises Lazarus from the dead. Many believe Jesus because of this miracle.

item.title: Chapter 44: The Savior Goes to Jerusalem
item.description: Jesus goes to Jerusalem for the Passover feast. Many people shout that Jesus is the king. This angers the Pharisees.

item.title: Chapter 45: The Widow’s Mites
item.description: Jesus tells the disciples of the poor widow who gave all she had to God.

item.title: Chapter 46: The Second Coming
item.description: Jesus tells His disciples of signs of the Second Coming. There will be false prophets, wars, famine, wickedness, and destruction. If the Lord's people are prepared, they should not fear.

item.title: Chapter 47: The Ten Virgins
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the ten virgins to teach about the need to prepare for His Second Coming.

item.title: Chapter 48: The Talents
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the talents to demonstrate how to use the gifts of God.

item.title: Chapter 49: The First Sacrament
item.description: New Testament Stories

item.title: Chapter 50: Other Teachings at the Last Supper
item.description: Jesus teaches His Apostles after the Last Supper and promises them the gift of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Chapter 51: Jesus Suffers in the Garden of Gethsemane
item.description: Jesus endures the pain of the sins of the world in the Garden of Gethsemane before He is betrayed by one of His friends.

item.title: Chapter 52: The Trials of Jesus
item.description: Jesus is betrayed by Judas and is put on trial in front of the Jews. They sentence Him to death.

item.title: Chapter 53: Jesus Is Crucified
item.description: Jesus suffers on the cross for the sins of the world.

item.title: Chapter 54: Jesus Is Risen
item.description: Jesus rises from the dead. He appears to Mary Magdalene and His Apostles as the resurrected Lord.

item.title: Chapter 55: The Apostles Lead the Church
item.description: Jesus gives the Apostles the power to lead the Church of Christ after His death.

item.title: Chapter 56: Peter Heals a Man
item.description: With the power of Jesus Christ, Peter heals a man who couldn't walk.

item.title: Chapter 57: Wicked Men Kill Stephen
item.description: The Jewish leaders become angry because the Apostles perform miracles after Jesus's death. Stephen is stoned to death.

item.title: Chapter 58: Simon and the Priesthood
item.description: Simon wants to buy the priesthood for money. Peter and John explain that the power of God is only given to righteous men.

item.title: Chapter 59: Saul Learns about Jesus
item.description: Saul was a wicked man. He sees a light and hears the voice of Jesus as he is traveling. He changes his name to Paul, repents, and becomes a powerful missionary and Apostle.

item.title: Chapter 60: Peter Brings Tabitha Back to Life
item.description: Peter heals Tabitha, and many people believe in Christ because of this miracle.

item.title: Chapter 61: Paul and Silas in Prison
item.description: Paul and Silas command an evil spirit to leave a girl's body. They go to prison for this act but are released through the power of prayer.

item.title: Chapter 62: Paul Obeys the Holy Ghost
item.description: Paul listens to the Holy Ghost and goes to Jerusalem, even though he knows they will put him in prison.

item.title: Chapter 63: Paul Finishes His Mission
item.description: Paul is persecuted by many people. He testifies of the Savior and of his personal conversion. He writes letters to Saints in other lands while he is in prison. Paul dies for his beliefs but knows he will live with God.

item.title: After the New Testament
item.description: After the death of Jesus, the Apostles tried to teach the gospel to the wicked people. The Apostles were killed, so the true church was taken away from the earth. Through the prophet Joseph Smith, God brought His gospel back to the earth.

item.title: Chapter 1: Before the Old Testament
item.description: We lived in heaven with Heavenly Father before this life. We had spirit bodies. We came to this earth to be tested in order to return to live with Him again. It is only through Jesus Christ's Atonement that we can return to live with God.

item.title: Chapter 2: Jesus Makes the Earth
item.description: Under the direction of Heavenly Father, Jesus Christ makes the earth.

item.title: Chapter 3: Adam and Eve
item.description: Adam and Eve live in the Garden of Eden. God tells them that they cannot eat of the tree of good and evil and remain in the garden. Satan tempts them to eat the fruit. God casts them out of the garden.

item.title: Chapter 4: Adam and His Family
item.description: Adam and Eve have many children. Cain kills Abel, and God punishes him for this sin.

item.title: Chapter 5: Enoch
item.description: The Lord takes up Enoch and his righteous people. Enoch sees many great things in a vision.

item.title: Chapter 6: Noah
item.description: Noah warns the people of their wickedness. He prophesies of a flood. They reject his words. Noah and his family are spared in the ark.

item.title: Chapter 7: The Tower of Babel
item.description: People build the tower of Babel to try to reach God in heaven. God changes their languages. God spares Jared and his family.

item.title: Chapter 8: Abraham
item.description: Abraham and Sarah are led to the promised land. Abraham pays his tithing to Melchizedek. They are promised a son.

item.title: Chapter 9: Abraham and the Sacrifice of Isaac
item.description: God commands Abraham to sacrifice his son Isaac. Abraham shows his obedience to the Lord, but an angel tells him to stop. The Lord provides a ram for the sacrifice.

item.title: Chapter 10: Jacob and Esau
item.description: Isaac and Rebekah have twin boys, Jacob and Esau. Esau gives his birthright blessing to Jacob in exchange for some pottage.

item.title: Chapter 11: Jacob and His Family
item.description: Jacob finds Rachel and Leah, and they have numerous children in Canaan, the promised land.

item.title: Chapter 12: Joseph
item.description: Joseph is his father's favorite son. His brothers become very jealous. They sell him as a slave into Egypt.

item.title: Chapter 13: Joseph in Egypt
item.description: Joseph is sold as a slave in Egypt. He becomes an adviser to the king because of his righteousness.

item.title: Chapter 14: Joseph’s Brothers in Egypt
item.description: Joseph reunites with his father and brothers and provides food and land for them.

item.title: Chapter 15: The Baby Moses
item.description: The king of Egypt orders all Israelite baby boys to be put to death. The baby Moses is spared by the daughter of the king.

item.title: Chapter 16: The Prophet Moses
item.description: Moses leaves Egypt. He sees the burning bush, and he hears the voice of Jesus Christ. He gives the king in Egypt many warnings to release the Israelites.

item.title: Chapter 17: The Passover
item.description: The Israelites put lamb's blood over their doors, and their children are spared from a terrible sickness. The Lord helps Moses and the Israelites flee Egypt by parting the Red Sea.

item.title: Chapter 18: The Israelites in the Wilderness
item.description: God provides manna and water for the Israelites in the wilderness.

item.title: Chapter 19: The Ten Commandments
item.description: Jesus Christ declares the Ten Commandments to the people on Mount Sinai.

item.title: Chapter 20: The Golden Calf
item.description: The Israelites worship idols instead of Jesus Christ. Moses receives the Ten Commandments and prophesies that the wicked will be destroyed.

item.title: Chapter 21: The Tabernacle
item.description: Moses tells the Israelites to build a tabernacle according to Jesus Christ's instructions. Jesus Christ promises to visit the tabernacle.

item.title: Chapter 22: Forty Years in the Wilderness
item.description: The Israelites travel for 40 years in the wilderness in search of the promised land.

item.title: Chapter 23: Joshua
item.description: Joshua becomes the prophet after Moses. Joshua parts the water so the Israelites can travel on dry ground. He leads the Israelites and marches around the walls of Jericho.

item.title: Chapter 24: Ruth and Naomi
item.description: Ruth takes care of Naomi, her mother-in-law, after Ruth's husband dies. Ruth is blessed with a righteous husband because of her love for and care of Naomi.

item.title: Chapter 25: Samuel
item.description: Samuel learns from the priest Eli. Although very young, Samuel is called as a prophet.

item.title: Chapter 26: King Saul
item.description: Saul becomes the king of Israel. Saul disobeys God by performing sacrifices without the prophet Samuel.

item.title: Chapter 27: Young David
item.description: Samuel goes to Bethlehem to find the next king of Israel. God chooses the young David to be the future king.

item.title: Chapter 28: David and Goliath
item.description: Young David defeats Goliath with God's help.

item.title: Chapter 29: King David
item.description: God blesses David and gives him success in many battles. David becomes king of Israel. He is a good king and obeys God's commandments. He lusts after Bathsheba and sins.

item.title: Chapter 30: King Solomon
item.description: God blesses King Solomon with wisdom. Solomon gives many people wise counsel. He advises two women who are arguing over a baby.

item.title: Chapter 31: The Temple
item.description: God tells King Solomon to build a temple. It is made out of the best material. The temple is the house of God.

item.title: Chapter 32: The Divided Kingdom
item.description: Solomon makes sacrifices to idols, and Israel is punished for wickedness. After Solomon dies, the twelve tribes of Israel are divided.

item.title: Chapter 33: The Prophet Elijah
item.description: Elijah hides from wicked King Ahab and Jezebel. He goes to the home of a poor woman and child. The woman prepares bread with their only supplies. The Lord blesses them with food and water during the famine and heals her dead son.

item.title: Chapter 34: Elijah and the Priests of Baal
item.description: Elijah shows the priests of Baal that idols have no power.

item.title: Chapter 35: Elijah Talks with Jesus
item.description: Elijah sees and talks with Jesus Christ. God tells Elijah that Elisha will be the new prophet.

item.title: Chapter 36: Elijah and Elisha
item.description: Elijah parts the Jordan River with his coat. Elijah is taken up into heaven. Elisha becomes the new prophet. He parts the river with Elijah's coat, and they recognize him as a prophet.

item.title: Chapter 37: The Prophet Elisha: Three Miracles
item.description: Elisha performs the miracle of the oil, raises a boy from the dead, and heals Naaman of leprosy.

item.title: Chapter 38: Jonah
item.description: Jonah refuses to warn the people according to the Lord's directions. He is swallowed by a large fish. He repents and declares repentance unto the people of Nineveh.

item.title: Chapter 39: The Israelites Are Captured
item.description: Wicked kings rule in Jerusalem. Prophets warn the people, but they do not listen. Babylon conquers them.

item.title: Chapter 40: Daniel and His Friends
item.description: Daniel and his friends obey God and request healthy food instead of meat and wine.

item.title: Chapter 41: Daniel and the King’s Dream
item.description: Daniel interprets the king's dream. The dream means the gospel will be preached all over the world. Daniel becomes leader over all the land.

item.title: Chapter 42: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego
item.description: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego refuse to pray to an idol. The king throws them into a hot furnace, and God saves them.

item.title: Chapter 43: Daniel and the Lions’ Den
item.description: King Darius issues a law to kill all those who pray to God. Daniel continues to pray and is thrown into the lions' den. God saves him from injury.

item.title: Chapter 44: Return to Jerusalem
item.description: The Jews return to Jerusalem and rebuild the temple. Some wicked men try to stop them. The prophets Ezra and Nehemiah give them instructions.

item.title: Chapter 45: Esther
item.description: Esther, a Jew, is chosen as the new queen. Esther saves her people by revealing wicked Haman's plan.

item.title: Chapter 46: Job
item.description: Job is a very righteous man. God knew that Job would remain righteous even if he was tried in all things. Satan could not destroy Job's faith.

item.title: Chapter 47: The Prophets Tell about Jesus
item.description: The prophets preach about Jesus Christ. They tell of His birth, life, death, and resurrection.

item.title: Chapter 48: After the Old Testament
item.description: Many Jews disobey God. Armies from other lands take them captive. Herod becomes the king over the Jews.

item.title: Chapter 1: Joseph Smith and His Family (1805–1820)
item.description: Joseph Smith's family is hardworking, loving, and full of faith. Joseph has an injured leg and has surgery without pain medication.

item.title: Chapter 2: Joseph Smith’s First Vision (1820)
item.description: Joseph prays to know which church to join. Heavenly Father and Jesus Christ appear to him and tell him that none of the churches are true.

item.title: Chapter 3: The Angel Moroni and the Gold Plates (1823–1827)
item.description: The angel Moroni appears to Joseph Smith and tells him about the Book of Mormon written on gold plates in the Hill Cumorah.

item.title: Chapter 4: Martin Harris and the Lost Pages (1827–1828)
item.description: Martin Harris desires to show 116 translated pages of the Book of Mormon to his family and others.

item.title: Chapter 5: Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery (February–April 1829)
item.description: Oliver Cowdery helps Joseph Smith translate the Book of Mormon. The Lord reveals many commandments.

item.title: Chapter 6: Joseph and Oliver Are Given the Priesthood: May 1829
item.description: Joseph and Oliver have questions about baptism. John the Baptist appears and gives the Aaronic Priesthood to them. They are both baptized.

item.title: Chapter 7: Witnesses See the Gold Plates (1829–1830)
item.description: Selected witnesses see the gold plates and testify that the plates are real.

item.title: Chapter 8: Getting Ready for the Church of Jesus Christ (April 1830)
item.description: Joseph receives a revelation about how to organize the true Church. He also learns more about Jesus Christ.

item.title: Chapter 9: Organization of the Church of Jesus Christ (6 April 1830)
item.description: While in New York, Joseph Smith organizes The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Chapter 10: The First Miracle in the Church (April 1830)
item.description: Oliver Cowdery teaches and baptizes many people. Newel Knight's testimony is strengthened after trials.

item.title: Chapter 11: More People Join the Church: April-June 1830
item.description: Many people learn about the Church and are baptized. Wicked men try to prevent the work from progressing, but the Lord protects His people.

item.title: Chapter 12: Samuel Smith's Mission (June 1830)
item.description: Samuel Smith, the first missionary for the Church, teaches people but has very little success. Many people, like Brigham Young, were converted later because of his efforts.

item.title: Chapter 13: Joseph and Emma (July 1830)
item.description: Joseph and Emma sacrifice much to spread the gospel. They rely on the Lord. Jesus tells Emma what she is supposed to do.

item.title: Chapter 14: The Prophet and Revelations for the Church (September 1830)
item.description: Only one man can receive revelation for the entire Church. Hyrum Page receives false revelations through a stone. He listens to the prophet and repents.

item.title: Chapter 15: A Mission to the Lamanites (September 1830)
item.description: Many Saints go on missions to the American Indians.

item.title: Chapter 16: Joseph Smith and Sidney Rigdon Learn about Zion (1830)
item.description: Sidney Rigdon is baptized and leads many to Christ. Through the Lord's help, Joseph and Sidney reveal some of the missing doctrine in the Bible.

item.title: Chapter 17: The First Bishops of the Church (February and December 1831)
item.description: Bishops are called to help teach, love, and help the Saints.

item.title: Chapter 18: The Law of the Church (9 February 1831)
item.description: The Law of the Church: 9 February 1831

item.title: Chapter 19: The Second Coming of Jesus Christ
item.description: Some people persecute the Saints of God in the last days. There are many signs to help prepare people for the Second Coming. The Lord will come again as the prophets have testified.

item.title: Chapter 20: Gifts of the Spirit (8 March 1831)
item.description: Through the power of the Holy Ghost, the Lord gives gifts of the Spirit to help others.

item.title: Chapter 21: A Revelation to Settle in Missouri (May–June 1831)
item.description: The Lord tells Joseph to lead the people to Missouri to build the city of Zion.

item.title: Chapter 22: Saints Begin to Settle in Missouri (July–August 1831)
item.description: The Saints arrive in Missouri and begin to build the city of Zion in Independence in Jackson County.

item.title: Chapter 23: The Doctrine and Covenants (August–November 1831)
item.description: The Lord tells Joseph to publish the revelations of the Lord. This book is called the Doctrine and Covenants.

item.title: Chapter 24: Parents Should Teach Their Children (November 1831)
item.description: Parents should teach the gospel of Jesus Christ to their children.

item.title: Chapter 25: Joseph Smith and Sidney Rigdon Go on a Mission (December 1831–January 1832)
item.description: Joseph Smith and Sidney Rigdon go to many towns and declare the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Chapter 26: The Three Kingdoms of Heaven (16 February 1832)
item.description: Heavenly Father reveals to Joseph Smith and Sidney Rigdon the places where people go after they are resurrected, called the three kingdoms of glory.

item.title: Chapter 27: The Prophet Continues His Work Despite Persecution (March 1832)
item.description: Mobs persecute Joseph Smith, but they cannot stop him from doing the Lord's work.

item.title: Chapter 28: The Prophet Joseph Goes to Missouri Again (March–May 1832)
item.description: The Lord gives the Saints in Missouri a revelation about how to take care of others.

item.title: Chapter 29: A Revelation about the Priesthood (September 1832)
item.description: Joseph receives instruction on how to use the power of God.

item.title: Chapter 30: A Revelation about War (25 December 1832)
item.description: The Saints worry about disasters and wars that occur. Jesus reveals a prophecy to Joseph Smith about the Civil War in the United States and diverse wars in the world.

item.title: Chapter 31: The Word of Wisdom (February 1833)
item.description: The Lord reveals to Joseph the Word of Wisdom, a health commandment requiring respect and honor for our bodies. The Lord promises many physical and spiritual blessings for complete obedience.

item.title: Chapter 32: The Church of Jesus Christ in Kirtland: 1833–1834
item.description: The Church's First Presidency, patriarch, and high council were called in Kirtland.

item.title: Chapter 33: A Revelation about Jesus Christ (May 1833)
item.description: Jesus tells about Himself and shows the right way to live.

item.title: Chapter 34: God Warns the People of Zion (July–August 1833)
item.description: God commands more people to move to Missouri. Mobs and evil people persecute the Saints.

item.title: Chapter 35: The Saints Leave Jackson County (Missouri, September–December 1833)
item.description: The governor and judges of Missouri refuse the help the Saints. Due to the persecution from mobs, the Saints leave Missouri.

item.title: Chapter 36: Zion’s Camp (February–June 1834)
item.description: Joseph Smith leads Zion's Camp, a group of men sent to help people in Jackson County.

item.title: Chapter 37: Priesthood Leaders (February–March 1835)
item.description: The Lord calls men to be prophets, apostles, and leaders.

item.title: Chapter 38: The Pearl of Great Price
item.description: The Pearl of Great Price is a book of scripture written by prophets. It contains the Book of Moses, the Book of Abraham, Joseph Smith—Matthew, Joseph Smith— History, and the Articles of Faith.

item.title: Chapter 39: The Kirtland Temple Is Dedicated (January–March 1836)
item.description: Joseph Smith sees a vision of the celestial kingdom. Many Saints come to the dedication of the Kirtland Temple, and angels appear.

item.title: Chapter 40: Visions in the Kirtland Temple (April 1836)
item.description: Joseph Smith and Oliver Cowdery see Jesus Christ, Moses, Elias, and Elijah and receive sacred priesthood power and keys.

item.title: Chapter 41: Trouble in Kirtland (1837–1838)
item.description: Many Saints have problems with the bank in Kirtland and blame Joseph Smith.

item.title: Chapter 42: Far West, Missouri (January–July 1838)
item.description: Joseph learns where the Lord will come for His Second Coming. Some leaders choose to disobey the prophet.

item.title: Chapter 43: Jesus Christ Names His Church (April 1838)
item.description: Jesus Christ names His church "The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints."

item.title: Chapter 44: Tithing (July 1838)
item.description: The Lord reveals that the Saints should give one-tenth of all they have to the Church.

item.title: Chapter 45: More Mobs in Missouri (1838–1839)
item.description: Mobs do terrible things to the Saints. They hurt and kill many people. Joseph and others are thrown into prison. Joseph silences the jail guards.

item.title: Chapter 46: Joseph Smith in Liberty Jail (November 1838-April 1839)
item.description: Joseph Smith and his friends suffer in Liberty Jail for more than four months. The Lord comforts him.

item.title: Chapter 48: Joseph Smith Asks the President for Help (March–November 1839)
item.description: Joseph Smith instructs the Saints to write down the crimes of those who were persecuting them. Joseph takes those letters to the president of the United States. The president does not help the Saints.

item.title: Chapter 49: Missionaries in Other Lands (June 1837–October 1841)
item.description: The Lord sends missionaries to England and Palestine. They teach the gospel to many people.

item.title: Chapter 50: The Saints in Nauvoo (January–July 1841)
item.description: Joseph Smith receives a revelation to build a temple in Nauvoo. The Lord calls Hyrum Smith to be the Patriarch. Brigham Young learns he is to stay at home with his family.

item.title: Chapter 51: The First Endowments (May 1842)
item.description: The Saints receive a special blessing in the temple called the endowment. They make promises and covenants with God and learn how to return to live with Him.

item.title: Chapter 52: The Relief Society (March 1842)
item.description: The Relief Society, a women's organization, is formed to help and bless the lives of others. The sisters make clothes for the men working at the temple, take care of the sick, and learn about the gospel.

item.title: Chapter 53: Trouble in Nauvoo (May–August 1842)
item.description: John C. Bennett, the mayor of Nauvoo, becomes wicked. Joseph Smith become mayor after conflict with Bennett. Joseph prophesies of future conflicts.

item.title: Chapter 54: God and Angels (February–April 1843)
item.description: Joseph Smith receives a revelation about angels. Heavenly Father and Jesus have a body of flesh and bones. The Holy Ghost is a spirit.

item.title: Chapter 55: A Revelation about Marriage (July 1843)
item.description: Righteous people who are married in the temple can live together forever with God.

item.title: Chapter 56: More Trouble for the Saints (1843–1844)
item.description: Mobs form and persecute the Saints. Enemies start a newspaper with lies about Mormons. Joseph says the Saints will eventually be forced to leave Nauvoo.

item.title: Chapter 57: The Prophet Is Killed (June 1844)
item.description: Although innocent, Joseph, Hyrum, and others go to Carthage Jail. A mob kills Joseph and Hyrum. They give their lives for the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Chapter 58: A New Leader for the Church (July–August 1844)
item.description: The Apostles lead the Church until a new leader is chosen. Sidney Rigdon wants to be the leader and apostatizes.
