item.title: Chapter 60: The Saints Leave Nauvoo (September 1845–September 1846)
item.description: The Lord chooses Brigham Young to be the leader after Joseph Smith's death. Mobs drive the Saints out of Nauvoo. The Saints travel in very difficult circumstances.

item.title: Chapter 61: The Mormon Battalion (June 1846–July 1847)
item.description: Brigham Young encourages men to help the United States army in a war against Mexico.

item.title: Chapter 63: The Pioneers Go to the Salt Lake Valley (April–July 1847)
item.description: The pioneers travel from Council Bluffs to the Salt Lake Valley. They set up Winter Quarters. The Lord tells Brigham Young to divide the people into companies.

item.title: Chapter 64: The Saints in the Rocky Mountains (Beginning in July 1847)
item.description: The Saints establish homes in the Salt Lake Valley. They build temples in the West. Many members from distant lands come to be with the Saints.

item.title: Chapter 65: The Church of Jesus Christ Today
item.description: The Church continues to grow with increasing members, missionaries, and temples worldwide.

item.title: Introduction: Before the Doctrine and Covenants
item.description: The plan of salvation provides a way for God's children to return to live with Him. We learn about this plan through the words of Christ and His prophets.

item.title: Overview of Church History
item.description: The History of the Church is briefly outlined and divided into six major periods.

item.title: "This is the Spirit of Revelation"
item.description: The early experiences of Oliver Cowdery serve as an example to help us understand principles of personal revelation.

item.title: The Works and Designs of God
item.description: Martin Harris tells a young man the story about the Book of Mormon manuscript pages that were lost.

item.title: "The Heart and a Willing Mind"
item.description: President Brigham Young tells how the testimony of a humble teacher helped him become converted to the restored gospel.

item.title: "A Man Without Eloquence"
item.description: President Brigham Young tells how the testimony of a humble teacher helped him become converted to the restored gospel.

item.title: "If They Harden Not Their Hearts"
item.description: During the Kirtland period, some members of the Church apostatized and suffered the consequences of their actions.

item.title: Zion's Camp
item.description: Several events from Zion's camp show how the march fulfilled the purposes of God.

item.title: Long- Promised Day
item.description: This presentation is a modern-day example of the Lord directing the Church through revelation to His prophet.

item.title: Endowed With Power
item.description: President Brigham Young speaks of the Saints receiving temple ordinances before leaving Nauvoo.

item.title: Joseph Smith: The Prophet of the Restoration
item.description: This review of the Prophet Joseph Smith's ministry shows how he "has done more, save Jesus only, for the salvation of men in this world" (D&C 135:3).

item.title: Johnny Lingo
item.description: Johnny Lingo bargains his dowry for a bride, paying an exorbitant dowry and causing a sensation on the island. Being an expert trader, he knows the value of things—especially self-esteem.

item.title: On the Lord's Errand: The Life of Thomas S. Monson
item.description: This biography of President Thomas S. Monson’s life highlights some of his great memories and experiences. Included in this video are interviews with President Monson, family members, and friends.

item.title: Saturday Morning Session
item.description: The Saturday Morning Session of the October 2013 General Conference.

item.title: How Wondrous and Great
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “How Wondrous and Great.”

item.title: Now Let Us Rejoice
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Now Let Us Rejoice.”

item.title: Welcome to Conference
item.description: It is my prayer that we may be filled with the Spirit of the Lord as we listen and learn.

item.title: Israel, Israel, God Is Calling
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Israel, Israel, God Is Calling.”

item.title: General Conference: Strengthening Faith and Testimony
item.description: Oh, how we need general conference! Through conferences our faith is fortified and our testimonies deepened.

item.title: Be Meek and Lowly of Heart
item.description: Being meek does not mean weakness, but it does mean behaving with goodness and kindness.

item.title: Do We Know What We Have?
item.description: Priesthood ordinances and covenants provide access to the fulness of the blessings promised to us by God, which are made possible by the Savior’s Atonement.

item.title: There Is Sunshine in My Soul Today
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “There Is Sunshine in My Soul Today.”

item.title: Look Ahead and Believe
item.description: In the sight of the Lord, it is not so much what we have done or where we have been but much more where we are willing to go.

item.title: The Windows of Heaven
item.description: Spiritual and temporal blessings come into our lives as we live the law of tithing.

item.title: Keep the Commandments
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Keep the Commandments.”

item.title: Come, Join with Us
item.description: Regardless of your circumstances, your personal history, or the strength of your testimony, there is room for you in this Church.

item.title: Come, Ye Thankful People
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Come, Ye Thankful People.”

item.title: Saturday Afternoon Session
item.description: The Saturday Afternoon Session of the October 2013 General Conference.

item.title: On This Day of Joy and Gladness
item.description: A family choir from stakes in Roy, Kanesville, Hooper, and West Haven sings “On This Day of Joy and Gladness.”

item.title: The Sustaining of Church Officers
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring conducts the sustaining of Church officers.

item.title: I Know That My Savior Loves Me
item.description: A family choir from stakes in Roy, Kanesville, Hooper, and West Haven sings “I Know That My Savior Loves Me.”

item.title: The Key to Spiritual Protection
item.description: Peace can be settled in the heart of each who turns to the scriptures and unlocks the promises of protection and redemption.

item.title: The Moral Force of Women
item.description: Your intuition is to do good and to be good, and as you follow the Holy Spirit, your moral authority and influence will grow.

item.title: Hastening the Lord's Game Plan!
item.description: We each must develop and carry out our own personal game plan to serve with enthusiasm alongside the full-time missionaries.

item.title: Press Forward, Saints
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Press Forward, Saints.”

item.title: Small and Simple Things
item.description: Let us reach out to others with faith and with love.

item.title: Wilt Thou Be Made Whole?
item.description: As we repent and become converted to the Lord, we become whole, and our guilt is swept away.

item.title: Like a Broken Vessel
item.description: How do you best respond when mental or emotional challenges confront you or those you love?

item.title: Put Your Trust in the Lord
item.description: Become engaged in doing what you can in sharing the great message of the Restoration of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Love at Home
item.description: A family choir from stakes in Roy, Kanesville, Hooper, and West Haven sings “Love at Home.”

item.title: Priesthood Session
item.description: The Priesthood Session of the October 2013 General Conference.

item.title: Sing Praise to Him
item.description: An Aaronic Priesthood choir from stakes in Murray sings “Sing Praise to Him.”

item.title: Like Ten Thousand Legions Marching
item.description: An Aaronic Priesthood choir from stakes in Murray sings “Like Ten Thousand Legions Marching.”

item.title: The Doctrines and Principles Contained in the Articles of Faith
item.description: Each article of faith adds unique value to our understanding of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Ye Are No More Strangers
item.description: In this Church there are no strangers and no outcasts. There are only brothers and sisters.

item.title: Called of Him to Declare His Word
item.description: If you are humble and obedient and hearken to the voice of the Spirit, you will find great happiness in your service as a missionary.

item.title: Do What Is Right
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Do What Is Right.”

item.title: You Can Do It Now!
item.description: As long as we are willing to rise up again and continue on the path, … we can learn something from failure and become better and happier.

item.title: Bind Up Their Wounds
item.description: I pray that we may prepare ourselves to give whatever priesthood service the Lord may set before us on our mortal journey.

item.title: True Shepherds
item.description: Home teaching answers many prayers and permits us to see the transformations which can take place in people’s lives.

item.title: God of Our Fathers, Whose Almighty Hand
item.description: An Aaronic Priesthood choir from stakes in Murray sings “God of Our Fathers, Whose Almighty Hand.”

item.title: Sunday Morning Session
item.description: The Sunday Morning Session of the October 2013 General Conference.

item.title: Sweet Is the Work
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Sweet Is the Work.”

item.title: Rejoice, the Lord Is King!
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Rejoice, the Lord Is King!”

item.title: Master, the Tempest Is Raging
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Master, the Tempest Is Raging.”

item.title: To My Grandchildren
item.description: There is one overarching commandment that will help us to meet the challenges and lead to the heart of a happy family life.

item.title: No Other Gods
item.description: Are we serving priorities or gods ahead of the God we profess to worship?

item.title: Be Ye Converted
item.description: True conversion occurs as you continue to act upon the doctrines you know are true and keep the commandments, day after day, month after month.

item.title: Put Your Shoulder to the Wheel
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Put Your Shoulder to the Wheel.”

item.title: The Strength to Endure
item.description: Our ability to endure to the end in righteousness will be in direct proportion to the strength of our testimony and the depth of our conversion.

item.title: Personal Strength through the Atonement of Jesus Christ
item.description: Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ, each of us can become clean and the burden of our rebellion will be lifted.

item.title: O Divine Redeemer
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “O Divine Redeemer.”

item.title: “I Will Not Fail Thee, nor Forsake Thee”
item.description: Our Heavenly Father … knows that we learn and grow and become stronger as we face and survive the trials through which we must pass.

item.title: We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet.”

item.title: Sunday Afternoon Session
item.description: The Sunday Afternoon Session of the October 2013 General Conference.

item.title: They, the Builders of the Nation
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “They, the Builders of the Nation.”

item.title: When He Comes Again
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “When He Comes Again.”

item.title: Lamentations of Jeremiah: Beware of Bondage
item.description: Our challenge is to avoid bondage of any kind, help the Lord gather His elect, and sacrifice for the rising generation.

item.title: Power in the Priesthood
item.description: A man may open the drapes so the warm sunlight comes into the room, but the man does not own the sun or the light or the warmth it brings.

item.title: Teaching with the Power and Authority of God
item.description: The Lord has provided the way for every worthy Latter-day Saint to teach in the Savior’s way.

item.title: Called to Serve
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Called to Serve.”

item.title: Continually Holding Fast
item.description: May we continually hold fast to the iron rod that leads to the presence of our Heavenly Father.

item.title: Look Up
item.description: Today is the time to look to the Source of truth and ensure that our testimonies are strong.

item.title: Drawing Closer to God
item.description: Our Savior wants us to really love Him to the point that we want to align our will with His.

item.title: Decisions for Eternity
item.description: The wise use of your freedom to make your own decisions is crucial to your spiritual growth, now and for eternity.

item.title: Till We Meet Again
item.description: May we show increased kindness toward one another, and may we ever be found doing the work of the Lord.

item.title: Abide with Me; 'Tis Eventide
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Abide with Me; 'Tis Eventide.”

item.title: How Firm a Foundation
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “How Firm a Foundation.”

item.title: Press Forward, Saints
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Press Forward, Saints.”

item.title: Lead, Kindly Light
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Lead, Kindly Light.”

item.title: Welcome to Conference
item.description: Thomas S. Monson opens general conference and tells of his experiences at the dedication of the Gilbert Arizona Temple.

item.title: The Cost—and Blessings—of Discipleship
item.description: Jeffrey R. Holland encourages us to live the gospel faithfully and courageously, even when it is difficult.

item.title: The Joyful Burden of Discipleship
item.description: Ronald A. Rasband teaches that we can receive joy by serving each other and bearing one other's burdens as disciples of the Lord.

item.title: Christ the Redeemer
item.description: Carlos H. Amado testifies that all who have lived or will live on earth are blessed by the Atonement of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Choose the Right
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Choose the Right.”

item.title: Protection from Pornography—a Christ-Focused Home
item.description: Linda S. Reeves warns families of the dangers of pornography and explains that the best filter is a strong testimony.

item.title: Spiritual Whirlwinds
item.description: Neil L. Andersen encourages youth to trust in God during challenges and promises that they will receive the Lord's protection and guidance.

item.title: A New Commandment I Give unto You
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “A New Commandment I Give unto You.”

item.title: A Priceless Heritage of Hope
item.description: Henry B. Eyring encourages us to leave an inheritance of hope for those who will follow our example.

item.title: Come, O Thou King of Kings
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Come, O Thou King of Kings.”

item.title: Glory to God on High
item.description: A combined choir from the Orem Institute of Religion sings “Glory to God on High.”

item.title: I Lived in Heaven
item.description: A combined choir from the Orem Institute of Religion sings “I Lived in Heaven.”

item.title: The Sustaining of Church Officers
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf presents the names of General Authorities and general Church officers to the membership for a sustaining vote.

item.title: Church Auditing Department Report, 2013
item.description: Church Auditing Department managing director Kevin R. Jergensen reads the auditing report for 2013.

item.title: Statistical Report, 2013
item.description: Secretary to the First Presidency Brook P. Hales reads the statistical report for 2013, including the total number of members.

item.title: Let Your Faith Show
item.description: Russell M. Nelson counsels us to increase our faith by living our religion. He encourages us not to hide our faith but to let it show.

item.title: “I Have Given You an Example”
item.description: Richard G. Scott explains how we can follow the Savior's example and be a loving influence for good in the lives of others.

item.title: We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet.”

item.title: “If Ye Love Me, Keep My Commandments”
item.description: Robert D. Hales teaches of the blessings that come when we use our agency to obey God's commandments, as the Savior Jesus Christ did.

item.title: Let’s Not Take the Wrong Way
item.description: Claudio D. Zivic counsels us to stay on the gospel path by keeping the commandments and to repent when we need to get back on the right path.

item.title: What Do You Think?
item.description: W. Craig Zwick encourages empathy for others and teaches that we must strive to understand what others are thinking.

item.title: Roots and Branches
item.description: Quentin L. Cook teaches the importance of hastening family history and temple work in our day, including through modern technology.

item.title: High on the Mountain Top
item.description: A combined choir from the Orem Institute of Religion sings “High on the Mountain Top.”

item.title: Saints, Behold How Great Jehovah
item.description: A priesthood choir from Brigham Young University - Idaho sings “Saints, Behold How Great Jehovah.”

item.title: Secret Prayer
item.description: A priesthood choir from Brigham Young University - Idaho sings “Secret Prayer.”

item.title: The Keys and Authority of the Priesthood
item.description: Dallin H. Oaks teaches how men and women, though they have different roles, serve and are blessed on the same terms through the priesthood.

item.title: What Manner of Men?
item.description: Donald L. Hallstrom urges priesthood holders to be willing to change in order to become more like the Savior Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Choice Generation
item.description: Randall L. Ridd offers four principles to help young men educate their desires and use technology wisely.

item.title: Rejoice, the Lord Is King!
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Rejoice, the Lord Is King!.”

item.title: Are You Sleeping through the Restoration?
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf cautions that selfishness, addictions, and competing priorities can keep us from giving our best effort as disciples of Christ.

item.title: The Priesthood Man
item.description: Henry B. Eyring teaches men how they can follow—and be—examples of selfless priesthood service.

item.title: Be Strong and of a Good Courage
item.description: Thomas S. Monson counsels priesthood holders to have moral courage in these challenging times and to be willing to defend their beliefs.

item.title: Abide with Me!
item.description: A priesthood choir from Brigham Young University - Idaho sings “Abide with Me!”

item.title: Come, We That Love the Lord
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Come, We That Love the Lord.”

item.title: On This Day of Joy and Gladness
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “On This Day of Joy and Gladness.”

item.title: Let Us All Press On
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Let Us All Press On.”

item.title: Grateful in Any Circumstances
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf teaches that we can choose to be grateful in any circumstances, including in the midst of tribulation.

item.title: Following Up
item.description: M. Russell Ballard encourages Latter-day Saints to be faithful missionaries and to follow up on their missionary efforts.

item.title: “Fear Not; I Am with Thee”
item.description: Jean A. Stevens teaches how greater faith and trust in the Lord can help us find peace and overcome challenges.

item.title: Teach Me to Walk in the Light
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Teach Me to Walk in the Light.”

item.title: Your Four Minutes
item.description: Gary E. Stevenson uses examples of Olympic athletes to illustrate how we should conduct our relatively short but all-important mortal lives.

item.title: Bear Up Their Burdens with Ease
item.description: David A. Bednar teaches that our challenges help us learn to rely on the Savior's Atonement.

item.title: A Child's Prayer
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “A Child's Prayer.”

item.title: Love—the Essence of the Gospel
item.description: Thomas S. Monson teaches how small acts of love, kindness, and forgiveness can make a big difference in others' lives.

item.title: Guide Us, O Thou Great Jehovah
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Guide Us, O Thou Great Jehovah.”

item.title: Sweet Is the Work
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Sweet Is the Work.”

item.title: I Stand All Amazed
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “I Stand All Amazed.”

item.title: The Witness
item.description: Boyd K. Packer testifies of God the Father, Jesus Christ, and the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Live True to the Faith
item.description: William R. Walker encourages Latter-day Saints to live true to the faith, honoring the legacy of their faithful ancestors.

item.title: Obedience through Our Faithfulness
item.description: L. Tom Perry teaches that obedience is a choice to trust in God's unlimited wisdom and power rather than our own limited knowledge and power.

item.title: Hark, All Ye Nations!
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Hark, All Ye Nations!”

item.title: The Prophet Joseph Smith
item.description: Lawrence E. Corbridge testifies of the important doctrine restored by the Prophet Joseph Smith.

item.title: Where Your Treasure Is
item.description: Michael John U. Teh teaches how we can make sure to put the things of God first in our lives rather than the things of this world.

item.title: If Ye Lack Wisdom
item.description: Marcos A. Aidukaitis gives guidance for recognizing truth—observing its fruits, experimenting on the word of God, and seeking personal revelation.

item.title: The Resurrection of Jesus Christ
item.description: D. Todd Christofferson shares many of the scriptural witnesses of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ as well as his own testimony.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: Thomas S. Monson expresses his hope that the spirit Latter-day Saints felt during general conference may abide with them.

item.title: Come, Let Us Anew
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Come, Let Us Anew.”

item.title: Hark, All Ye Nations!
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Hark, All Ye Nations!”

item.title: Daughters in His Kingdom
item.description: A combined Primary, Young Women, and Relief Society choir from stakes in the Wasatch Front sings “Daughters in His Kingdom.”

item.title: Keeping Covenants Protects Us, Prepares Us, and Empowers Us
item.description: Rosemary M. Wixom encourages girls and women of all ages to make and keep sacred covenants in order to return to Heavenly Father's presence.

item.title: Video Presentation: I Am a Child of God
item.description: Women and children from around the world come together to declare, “I am a child of God.”

item.title: Sisterhood: Oh, How We Need Each Other
item.description: Bonnie L. Oscarson teaches that we can learn from girls and women of all ages and that we must avoid judging each other.

item.title: Wanted: Hands and Hearts to Hasten the Work
item.description: Linda K. Burton teaches that we can be devoted disciples of Jesus Christ by serving others and furthering the work of salvation.

item.title: Hymn Medley: Lord, I Would Follow Thee—Love One Another
item.description: A combined Primary, Young Women, and Relief Society choir from stakes in the Wasatch Front sings a medley of “Lord, I Would Follow Thee” and “Love One Another.”

item.title: Daughters in the Covenant
item.description: Henry B. Eyring encourages women to keep their covenants, including those made at baptism, as they progress along the path back to Heavenly Father.

item.title: Lesson 1: The Message of the New Testament
item.description: Elder Thomas S. Monson speaks of the message of hope and joy in the New Testament.

item.title: Lesson 3: Luke II
item.description: This segment portrays the account of Jesus's birth.

item.title: Lesson 5: The Woman at the Well
item.description: Jesus teaches a Samaritan woman that He is the source of living water.

item.title: Lesson 6: New Testament Customs—Anointed One
item.description: Jesus declares He is the promised Messiah to the people in the synagogue.

item.title: Lesson 6: New Testament Customs—Purse and Scrip
item.description: A purse holds money, and a scrip is a travel bag.

item.title: Lesson 6: New Testament Customs—Worship in the Synagogue
item.description: Congregation members in the synagogue participate in gospel instructions. Paul uses this to teach the gospel.

item.title: Lesson 8: New Testament Customs—Schoolmaster
item.description: The Law of Moses prepared people for the Savior's higher law.

item.title: Lesson 9: New Testament Customs—Phylacteries
item.description: Pharisees boast of their righteousness with larger phylacteries and longer garment fringes.

item.title: Lesson 10: Come Unto Me
item.description: A woman anoints Jesus's feet with oil. Jesus teaches the parable of the two debtors.

item.title: Lesson 16: New Testament Customs—The Synagogue
item.description: Those that were kicked out of the synagogue were considered excommunicated.

item.title: Lesson 18: New Testament Customs—Leprosy
item.description: Leprosy was the most feared disease in the Holy Land.

item.title: Lesson 18: New Testament Customs—Time
item.description: In the ancient Middle East, time was divided differently than today's current measurements.

item.title: Lesson 20: New Testament Customs—Phylacteries
item.description: Pharisees boast of their righteousness with larger phylacteries and longer garment fringes.

item.title: Lesson 22: New Testament Customs—Marriage
item.description: Traditionally, the bridegroom journeys through town to meet his bride.

item.title: Lesson 23: New Testament Customs—Feasting
item.description: Feasting was done reclining on couches.

item.title: Lesson 25: New Testament Customs—Olive Press
item.description: Gethsemane means "oil press."

item.title: Lesson 26: To This End Was I Born
item.description: This segment portrays the final hours of Jesus's mortal life. It also portrays His ministry in the spirit world and His Resurrection.

item.title: Lesson 31: The Second Coming
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer and Elder Neal A. Maxwell give counsel and caution regarding the Second Coming.

item.title: Lesson 38: Paul—A Chosen Vessel
item.description: This segment relates the life and mission of Paul.

item.title: Introduction: Our Heavenly Father’s Plan
item.description: Heavenly Father's plan provides everyone a way to return to live with Him through the sacrifice of His son, Jesus Christ. His prophets tell us what we should do.

item.title: Chapter 1: Elisabeth and Zacharias
item.description: An angel tells Zacharias that he and his wife, Elisabeth, will have a son even though they are both very old. Zacharias doesn't believe the angel, so the angel tells him he will not be able to talk until the child is born.

item.title: Chapter 2: Mary and the Angel
item.description: The angel Gabriel comes to Mary and tells her she is to be the mother of the Son of God.

item.title: Chapter 3: John the Baptist Is Born
item.description: Mary goes to visit Elisabeth and the Holy Ghost tells Elisabeth about Mary's baby. Elisabeth's son is born and they name him John as the angel instructed them. Zacharias is able to speak again.

item.title: Chapter 4: Joseph and the Angel
item.description: An angel appears to Joseph in a dream and tells him that Mary's child is the Son of God.

item.title: Chapter 5: Jesus Christ Is Born
item.description: Jesus Christ is born in Bethlehem. Angels tell nearby shepherds of his birth, and they come to worship him.

item.title: Chapter 6: Presentation at the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph bring Jesus to the temple in Jerusalem. Simeon and Anna, two righteous people, see Jesus and praise God.

item.title: Chapter 7: The Wise Men
item.description: Wise men from another land travel to Bethlehem to worship and give gifts to the baby Jesus.

item.title: Chapter 8: Wicked King Herod
item.description: An angel warns Joseph in a dream to take Jesus and Mary to Egypt to escape the wicked King Herod.

item.title: Chapter 9: The Boy Jesus
item.description: The boy Jesus answers the teachers' questions in the temple.

item.title: Chapter 10: Jesus Is Baptized
item.description: John the Baptist prepares the way for Jesus by preaching the gospel and baptizing many people. Jesus comes to John to be baptized and sets the example for all mankind.

item.title: Chapter 11: Jesus Is Tempted
item.description: The devil comes to Jesus as he is fasting and tempts him three times.

item.title: Chapter 12: The Wedding in Cana
item.description: Jesus performs a miracle at a wedding feast in Cana by turning water into wine.

item.title: Chapter 13: Jesus and His Heavenly Father’s House
item.description: Jesus clears the temple of merchants.

item.title: Chapter 14: Nicodemus
item.description: Nicodemus, a Pharisee, comes to talk to Jesus. Jesus tells him that no one can enter heaven without being spiritually born again.

item.title: Chapter 15: The Woman at the Well
item.description: Jesus talks to a Samaritan woman at a well. He tells her about the living water of eternal life, and she tells many people about Jesus's teachings.

item.title: Chapter 16: The Leader’s Son
item.description: Jesus heals the son of a Jewish leader.

item.title: Chapter 17: Angry People in Nazareth
item.description: Jesus tells doubtful, angry Jews in Nazareth that He is the Savior. They try to kill Jesus, but He escapes.

item.title: Chapter 18: Jesus Chooses His Apostles
item.description: Jesus teaches and performs a miracle for a group of fishermen. He tells three of them to follow him and become "fishers of men." He calls and ordains twelve Apostles to preach the gospel and heal people.

item.title: Chapter 19: The Sermon on the Mount
item.description: Jesus gives the Sermon on the Mount. He teaches what we must do to be happy and to return to live with Heavenly Father again.

item.title: Chapter 20: Jesus Teaches about Prayer
item.description: Jesus teaches his disciples that they should pray privately and sincerely. He gives a prayer to show them an example and promises that Heavenly Father will answer their prayers.

item.title: Chapter 21: Jesus Commands the Winds and the Waves
item.description: Jesus calms a storm on the sea, and his disciples marvel that even the wind and sea obey Him.

item.title: Chapter 22: The Man with the Evil Spirits
item.description: Jesus casts evil spirits out of a man. The man believes in Jesus, but others are afraid.

item.title: Chapter 23: The Man Who Could Not Walk
item.description: The friends of a man who cannot walk bring him to see Jesus. Jesus tells the man his sins are forgiven and heals him.

item.title: Chapter 24: Jairus’s Daughter is Raised from the Dead
item.description: A man, Jairus, asks Jesus to come heal his sick daughter. The girl dies before Jesus arrives, but He raises her from the dead.

item.title: Chapter 25: A Woman Touches Jesus’s Clothes
item.description: A faithful woman is healed by simply touching Jesus's clothes.

item.title: Chapter 26: Jesus Forgives a Woman
item.description: A woman with many sins washes Jesus's feet with her hair. A Pharisee criticizes Him, but Jesus tells the Pharisee that the woman's sins are forgiven because of her love for the Savior and her faith.

item.title: Chapter 27: Doing His Father’s Work on Earth
item.description: Jesus heals a man on the Sabbath. This angers many people, but He tells them He was doing what His Father would do.

item.title: Chapter 28: Jesus Feeds 5,000 People
item.description: Jesus miraculously feeds a crowd of 5,000 people.

item.title: Chapter 29: Jesus Walks on the Water
item.description: Jesus walks on water. Peter tries but is afraid and begins to sink. Jesus asks him why he doesn't have more faith.

item.title: Chapter 30: The Bread of Life
item.description: Jesus teaches that He is the Bread of Life. He teaches that if people believe and follow Him they will have everlasting life.

item.title: Chapter 31: Jesus Heals a Deaf Man
item.description: Jesus heals a deaf man, and the people are astonished.

item.title: Chapter 32: Peter Testifies of Christ
item.description: Peter says Jesus is the Son of God. Jesus tells Peter that his testimony has come from God. He tells Peter that he will lead the Church. Jesus tells His disciples that He will suffer, die, and rise on the third day.

item.title: Chapter 33: Appearing in Glory: The Transfiguration
item.description: Jesus is transfigured on a mountaintop. He is visited by Moses and Elias. Peter, James, and John witness Jesus's glory and hear the voice of Heavenly Father testifying of Jesus.

item.title: Chapter 34: The Boy with an Evil Spirit
item.description: Jesus heals a boy who has an evil spirit. The disciples ask why they hadn't been able to heal the same boy, and Jesus tells them that sometimes fasting and prayer is necessary to heal.

item.title: Chapter 35: The Good Samaritan
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the good Samaritan to a Jewish leader to illustrate how we are to love our neighbor as ourselves.

item.title: Chapter 36: Jesus Tells Three Parables
item.description: Jesus tells three parables to illustrate how God feels when sinners repent and return to Him.

item.title: The First Parable: The Lost Sheep
item.description: The shepherd searches for and saves the lost sheep.

item.title: The Second Parable: The Lost Coin
item.description: Jesus teaches about the woman who searches for her lost coin.

item.title: The Third Parable: The Lost Son
item.description: Jesus tells of a son who sins and returns home seeking forgiveness.

item.title: Chapter 37: The Ten Lepers
item.description: Jesus heals ten lepers, but only one of them returns to thank him.

item.title: Chapter 38: The Pharisee and the Publican
item.description: Jesus tells a story about a Pharisee and a publican.

item.title: Chapter 39: Jesus Heals a Blind Man
item.description: Jesus heals a blind man and explains that physical trials do not come as a result of sin.

item.title: Chapter 40: The Good Shepherd
item.description: Jesus calls himself the Good Shepherd and explains that there are other sheep not of this fold.

item.title: Chapter 41: Jesus Blesses the Children
item.description: Jesus blesses the children and tells the disciples that they must become like little children to enter heaven.

item.title: Chapter 42: The Rich Young Man
item.description: Jesus tells a rich young man to sell all of his possessions and give the money to the poor. The rich man loved his riches more than God.

item.title: Chapter 43: Jesus Brings Lazarus Back to Life
item.description: Jesus raises Lazarus from the dead. Many believe Jesus because of this miracle.

item.title: Chapter 44: The Savior Goes to Jerusalem
item.description: Jesus goes to Jerusalem for the Passover feast. Many people shout that Jesus is the king. This angers the Pharisees.

item.title: Chapter 45: The Widow’s Mites
item.description: Jesus tells the disciples of the poor widow who gave all she had to God.

item.title: Chapter 46: The Second Coming
item.description: Jesus tells His disciples of signs of the Second Coming. There will be false prophets, wars, famine, wickedness, and destruction. If the Lord's people are prepared, they should not fear.

item.title: Chapter 47: The Ten Virgins
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the ten virgins to teach about the need to prepare for His Second Coming.

item.title: Chapter 48: The Talents
item.description: Jesus tells the parable of the talents to demonstrate how to use the gifts of God.

item.title: Chapter 49: The First Sacrament
item.description: New Testament Stories

item.title: Chapter 50: Other Teachings at the Last Supper
item.description: Jesus teaches His Apostles after the Last Supper and promises them the gift of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Chapter 51: Jesus Suffers in the Garden of Gethsemane
item.description: Jesus endures the pain of the sins of the world in the Garden of Gethsemane before He is betrayed by one of His friends.

item.title: Chapter 52: The Trials of Jesus
item.description: Jesus is betrayed by Judas and is put on trial in front of the Jews. They sentence Him to death.

item.title: Chapter 53: Jesus Is Crucified
item.description: Jesus suffers on the cross for the sins of the world.

item.title: Chapter 54: Jesus Is Risen
item.description: Jesus rises from the dead. He appears to Mary Magdalene and His Apostles as the resurrected Lord.

item.title: Chapter 55: The Apostles Lead the Church
item.description: Jesus gives the Apostles the power to lead the Church of Christ after His death.

item.title: Chapter 56: Peter Heals a Man
item.description: With the power of Jesus Christ, Peter heals a man who couldn't walk.

item.title: Chapter 57: Wicked Men Kill Stephen
item.description: The Jewish leaders become angry because the Apostles perform miracles after Jesus's death. Stephen is stoned to death.

item.title: Chapter 58: Simon and the Priesthood
item.description: Simon wants to buy the priesthood for money. Peter and John explain that the power of God is only given to righteous men.

item.title: Chapter 59: Saul Learns about Jesus
item.description: Saul was a wicked man. He sees a light and hears the voice of Jesus as he is traveling. He changes his name to Paul, repents, and becomes a powerful missionary and Apostle.

item.title: Chapter 60: Peter Brings Tabitha Back to Life
item.description: Peter heals Tabitha, and many people believe in Christ because of this miracle.

item.title: Chapter 61: Paul and Silas in Prison
item.description: Paul and Silas command an evil spirit to leave a girl's body. They go to prison for this act but are released through the power of prayer.

item.title: Chapter 62: Paul Obeys the Holy Ghost
item.description: Paul listens to the Holy Ghost and goes to Jerusalem, even though he knows they will put him in prison.

item.title: Chapter 63: Paul Finishes His Mission
item.description: Paul is persecuted by many people. He testifies of the Savior and of his personal conversion. He writes letters to Saints in other lands while he is in prison. Paul dies for his beliefs but knows he will live with God.

item.title: After the New Testament
item.description: After the death of Jesus, the Apostles tried to teach the gospel to the wicked people. The Apostles were killed, so the true church was taken away from the earth. Through the prophet Joseph Smith, God brought His gospel back to the earth.

item.description: A video describes the importance of the atonement in our lives due to the fall of Adam and Eve.

item.title: For God Did Send Me
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley teaches to hold the God's standards high and be an example to the world.

item.title: Generous Fast Offerings
item.description: Elder Worthlin encourages church members to give generous fast offerings.

item.title: Gliding Naively through Life
item.description: Elder Maxwell teaches that we need to experience challenges in our lives.

item.title: God Has Held You in Reserve
item.description: Elder Marvin J. Ashton teaches about the last generation of righteous church members (Abraham 3:22-28).

item.title: How a Priesthood Bearer Should Dress
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland gives a suggestion on how priesthood bearers should dress.

item.title: I've Got to Find Out Who I Am
item.description: A song about finding out who we are.

item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland Narrates a depiction of the story of Moses

item.title: Joseph in Egypt
item.description: President Benson teaches church members to choose God first.

item.title: Many Esaus
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches to seek spiritual things before worldly things.

item.title: Many Plain and Precious Things
item.description: A video explaining the importance of the Joseph Smith translation of the bible.

item.title: Nothing Accidental or Spontaneous
item.description: A video explaining that God's creations are made with a purpose.

item.title: Our Father's Plan
item.description: A song about Heavenly Father's divine plan (Abraham 3:22-28).

item.title: Our Own Liahona
item.description: President Monson explains how Patriarchal blessings can be our own Liahona.

item.title: Peculiar People
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson explains the meaning of peculiar people.

item.title: Priesthood Blessings
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches the significance of a priesthood blessing.

item.title: Put God First
item.description: President Benson teaches church members to put God first in their lives.

item.title: Real, Personal Sacrifice
item.description: Elder Maxwell teaches the importance of sacrifice.

item.title: Reverence Invites Revelation
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer teaches that reverence invites the spirit of revelation.

item.title: Sacrament of the Lords Supper
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry explains the importance of the Lord's supper.

item.title: Sacrifice and Sacrament
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry explains the correlation of sacrifice and the sacrament.

item.title: Salvation through Christ
item.description: President Benson teaches that salvation is only through Christ.

item.title: Separating Ourselves from the World
item.description: Elder Hales teaches church members to be in the world but not of the world.

item.title: Shun Immorality
item.description: President Hinckley encourages church members to avoid the immorality we have in the world today.

item.title: Sin Results in Suffering
item.description: Elder Ballard speaks on the suffering that sin can bring to our lives.

item.title: Sin of Murmuring
item.description: Elder Maxwell explains that murmuring is a sin of the natural man.

item.title: Skiing Expedition
item.description: A young man learns the importance of trusting an experienced guide as they ski down a mountain.

item.title: Temporal Preparation
item.description: President Hinckley encourages church members to be prepared for future calamities.

item.title: The Abrahamic Covenant
item.description: One family shows love and service to another less fortunate family.

item.title: The Atonement
item.description: A video explaining the atonement and our potential.

item.title: The Creation
item.description: Elder Nelson explains the creation and its importance.

item.title: The Importance of the Old Testament
item.description: President Packer lists the doctrines and principles taught in the Old Testament.

item.title: The Passover
item.description: A short video explaining the meaning of the Passover and it's significance.

item.title: The Power and Authority of God
item.description: President Faust explains the power of the priesthood and encourages priesthood holders to live worthily of its power.

item.title: The Tabernacle
item.description: A video explaining the Tabernacle and it's importance.

item.title: Things of the World
item.description: Elder Scott teaches to eliminate distractions from our lives.

item.title: Thousands of Millions
item.description: A video teaching that the choices we make in this life can affect the generations to come.

item.title: Windows of Personal Revelation
item.description: Elder Wirthlin teaches that if we keep our bodies pure and obey the Word of Wisdom the windows of revelation will be open unto us.

item.title: Blessings of Repentance
item.description: Elder Scott teaches the wonderful blessing of repentance (2 Samuel 13-22).

item.title: Choose to Be Humble
item.description: President Hinckley encourages church member to choose to be humble.

item.title: Eyewitness News at Six (586 BC)
item.description: A news team gives report of the destruction of Jerusalem (2 Kings 24-25).

item.title: Eyewitness News at Six (600 BC)
item.description: A news team gives updates on life in 600 BC (2 Kings 24-25).

item.title: Faith and Trials
item.description: Elder Hales teaches to show faith during trials (Job 42:10-17).

item.title: For Such a Time as This
item.description: Showing her faith, Esther demonstrates courage by standing up for the Jews (Esther 1-4).

item.title: For This Child I Prayed
item.description: A young women ponders the decision of having a family and its importance.

item.title: Full Commitment
item.description: President Hunter speaks on Joshua's commitment to following the commandments of the Lord.

item.title: God Helps Ordinary People
item.description: President Faust relates the story of Gideon from the Bible, explaining that the Lord can do remarkable things through a person with ordinary faith.

item.title: Hannah's Faith
item.description: Hannah prays to the Lord to bless her with a son.

item.title: I Am Clean
item.description: President Hinckley relates a dream that was had by President Joseph F. Smith (Psalms 24:3-4).

item.title: Josiah and the Book of the Law
item.description: King Josiah motivates his kingdom to repent from their wicked ways by reading from the Book of the Law (2 Kings 22-23).

item.title: Measure of Our Hearts
item.description: Elder Marvin J. Ashton explains how the Lord measures our hearts.

item.title: Naaman and Elisha
item.description: Naaman is healed by following the prophets counsel (2 Kings 5:1-14).

item.title: No Other Gods Before Me
item.description: A young man relates the dangers of carbon monoxide to that of Idolatry (Joshua 23-24).

item.title: Obedience
item.description: President Benson teaches obedience and that we should love the Lord (2 Kings 5:1-14).

item.title: Parachutes
item.description: A video describing the importance of following instructions (Proverbs 3:5-6).

item.title: Parents Choices Affect Children
item.description: Elder Maxwell teaches that choices made by parents have large effects on their children.

item.title: Pride
item.description: Elder Ballard tells the story of Naaman and relates it to pride (2 Kings 5:1-19).

item.title: Samuel and Eli
item.description: Samuel hears the voice of Lord.

item.title: Singing Hymns
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches the importance of singing Hymns (Psalms).

item.title: Spirit Whispers
item.description: President Eyring teaches that the Spirit will bear testimony if we listen (1 Kings 19:11-13).

item.title: Still, Small Voice
item.description: President Packer lists the doctrines and principles taught in the Old Testament (1 Kings 19:11-13).

item.title: Support through Trials
item.description: Elder Scott teaches that we will grow stronger and the Lord will bless us as we pass through trials (Job 1-23).

item.title: Temple Ordinances Are Crucial
item.description: President Hunter explains the importance of temple attendance (1 Kings 6).

item.title: Temples Are Built by Faith and Sacrifice
item.description: President Monson teaches that temples are built my the sacrifices of members of the church (2 Chronicles 1-7).

item.title: The Lord Will Deliver Me
item.description: Elder Oaks tells the story of David and Goliath.

item.title: To Look Upon
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks relates the story of King David to illustrate the dangers of pornography (2 Samuel 11).

item.title: True Friend
item.description: President Eyring explains the importance of having a true friend.

item.title: Walk His Way
item.description: A song about choosing to walk in the ways of the Lord.

item.title: Whom the Lord Calls
item.description: President Monson teaches "whom the Lord calls, the Lord qualifies."

item.title: Worldly Pleasures
item.description: Elder Perry encourages church members to seek of the things of the spirit and not those of the world (Ecclesiastes 1-2).

item.title: Worldwide Access to Temples
item.description: President Hinckley expresses his desire that a temple be built in close distance to all latter-day saints (Ezra 1-6).

item.title: Arabian Horse
item.description: A video shows how an Arabian horse is trained to be totally obedient (Jeremiah 11:4).

item.title: Daniel in the Lions' Den
item.description: The Lord delivers Daniel from the lion's den (Daniel 6).

item.title: Following the Prophet
item.description: President Eyring speaks on the importance of listening to the prophet (Jeremiah 20-21).

item.title: God Reveals His Secrets
item.description: A video depicting how God has spoken to his prophets (Amos 3:7).

item.title: Paying Tithing
item.description: Elder Oaks explains the importance of paying tithing (Malachi 3:8-12).

item.title: Perilous Times
item.description: President Hinckley teaches that despite the perilous times that we live in we can all have peace in our lives by living the gospel (Isaiah 24).

item.title: Piano Recital
item.description: A young man learns the importance of practice and to avoid procrastination (Joel 2).

item.title: Stand a Little Taller
item.description: President Hinckley challenges church members to stand a little taller (Ezekiel 5-15).

item.title: The Gardener
item.description: A gardener anxiously awaits the return of the housemaster (Joel 2).

item.title: The Incomparable Atonement
item.description: President Faust explains the importance of the Atonement and encourages church members to learn more about it (Isaiah 53).

item.title: The Sealing Power
item.description: A woman bears testimony of the sealing powers of the priesthood (Malachi 4:5-6).

item.title: Watchman on the Tower
item.description: The Lord calls prophets to be the "watchmen" on the tower (Ezekiel 33:1-7).

item.title: Wherefore Have We Fasted
item.description: A young man recounts a lesson learned from his youth (Isaiah 58).

item.title: Chapter 1: Before the Old Testament
item.description: We lived in heaven with Heavenly Father before this life. We had spirit bodies. We came to this earth to be tested in order to return to live with Him again. It is only through Jesus Christ's Atonement that we can return to live with God.

item.title: Chapter 2: Jesus Makes the Earth
item.description: Under the direction of Heavenly Father, Jesus Christ makes the earth.

item.title: Chapter 3: Adam and Eve
item.description: Adam and Eve live in the Garden of Eden. God tells them that they cannot eat of the tree of good and evil and remain in the garden. Satan tempts them to eat the fruit. God casts them out of the garden.

item.title: Chapter 4: Adam and His Family
item.description: Adam and Eve have many children. Cain kills Abel, and God punishes him for this sin.

item.title: Chapter 5: Enoch
item.description: The Lord takes up Enoch and his righteous people. Enoch sees many great things in a vision.

item.title: Chapter 6: Noah
item.description: Noah warns the people of their wickedness. He prophesies of a flood. They reject his words. Noah and his family are spared in the ark.

item.title: Chapter 7: The Tower of Babel
item.description: People build the tower of Babel to try to reach God in heaven. God changes their languages. God spares Jared and his family.

item.title: Chapter 8: Abraham
item.description: Abraham and Sarah are led to the promised land. Abraham pays his tithing to Melchizedek. They are promised a son.

item.title: Chapter 9: Abraham and the Sacrifice of Isaac
item.description: God commands Abraham to sacrifice his son Isaac. Abraham shows his obedience to the Lord, but an angel tells him to stop. The Lord provides a ram for the sacrifice.

item.title: Chapter 10: Jacob and Esau
item.description: Isaac and Rebekah have twin boys, Jacob and Esau. Esau gives his birthright blessing to Jacob in exchange for some pottage.

item.title: Chapter 11: Jacob and His Family
item.description: Jacob finds Rachel and Leah, and they have numerous children in Canaan, the promised land.

item.title: Chapter 12: Joseph
item.description: Joseph is his father's favorite son. His brothers become very jealous. They sell him as a slave into Egypt.

item.title: Chapter 13: Joseph in Egypt
item.description: Joseph is sold as a slave in Egypt. He becomes an adviser to the king because of his righteousness.

item.title: Chapter 14: Joseph’s Brothers in Egypt
item.description: Joseph reunites with his father and brothers and provides food and land for them.

item.title: Chapter 15: The Baby Moses
item.description: The king of Egypt orders all Israelite baby boys to be put to death. The baby Moses is spared by the daughter of the king.

item.title: Chapter 16: The Prophet Moses
item.description: Moses leaves Egypt. He sees the burning bush, and he hears the voice of Jesus Christ. He gives the king in Egypt many warnings to release the Israelites.

item.title: Chapter 17: The Passover
item.description: The Israelites put lamb's blood over their doors, and their children are spared from a terrible sickness. The Lord helps Moses and the Israelites flee Egypt by parting the Red Sea.

item.title: Chapter 18: The Israelites in the Wilderness
item.description: God provides manna and water for the Israelites in the wilderness.

item.title: Chapter 19: The Ten Commandments
item.description: Jesus Christ declares the Ten Commandments to the people on Mount Sinai.

item.title: Chapter 20: The Golden Calf
item.description: The Israelites worship idols instead of Jesus Christ. Moses receives the Ten Commandments and prophesies that the wicked will be destroyed.

item.title: Chapter 21: The Tabernacle
item.description: Moses tells the Israelites to build a tabernacle according to Jesus Christ's instructions. Jesus Christ promises to visit the tabernacle.

item.title: Chapter 22: Forty Years in the Wilderness
item.description: The Israelites travel for 40 years in the wilderness in search of the promised land.

item.title: Chapter 23: Joshua
item.description: Joshua becomes the prophet after Moses. Joshua parts the water so the Israelites can travel on dry ground. He leads the Israelites and marches around the walls of Jericho.

item.title: Chapter 24: Ruth and Naomi
item.description: Ruth takes care of Naomi, her mother-in-law, after Ruth's husband dies. Ruth is blessed with a righteous husband because of her love for and care of Naomi.

item.title: Chapter 25: Samuel
item.description: Samuel learns from the priest Eli. Although very young, Samuel is called as a prophet.

item.title: Chapter 26: King Saul
item.description: Saul becomes the king of Israel. Saul disobeys God by performing sacrifices without the prophet Samuel.

item.title: Chapter 27: Young David
item.description: Samuel goes to Bethlehem to find the next king of Israel. God chooses the young David to be the future king.

item.title: Chapter 28: David and Goliath
item.description: Young David defeats Goliath with God's help.

item.title: Chapter 29: King David
item.description: God blesses David and gives him success in many battles. David becomes king of Israel. He is a good king and obeys God's commandments. He lusts after Bathsheba and sins.

item.title: Chapter 30: King Solomon
item.description: God blesses King Solomon with wisdom. Solomon gives many people wise counsel. He advises two women who are arguing over a baby.

item.title: Chapter 31: The Temple
item.description: God tells King Solomon to build a temple. It is made out of the best material. The temple is the house of God.

item.title: Chapter 32: The Divided Kingdom
item.description: Solomon makes sacrifices to idols, and Israel is punished for wickedness. After Solomon dies, the twelve tribes of Israel are divided.

item.title: Chapter 33: The Prophet Elijah
item.description: Elijah hides from wicked King Ahab and Jezebel. He goes to the home of a poor woman and child. The woman prepares bread with their only supplies. The Lord blesses them with food and water during the famine and heals her dead son.

item.title: Chapter 34: Elijah and the Priests of Baal
item.description: Elijah shows the priests of Baal that idols have no power.

item.title: Chapter 35: Elijah Talks with Jesus
item.description: Elijah sees and talks with Jesus Christ. God tells Elijah that Elisha will be the new prophet.

item.title: Chapter 36: Elijah and Elisha
item.description: Elijah parts the Jordan River with his coat. Elijah is taken up into heaven. Elisha becomes the new prophet. He parts the river with Elijah's coat, and they recognize him as a prophet.

item.title: Chapter 37: The Prophet Elisha: Three Miracles
item.description: Elisha performs the miracle of the oil, raises a boy from the dead, and heals Naaman of leprosy.

item.title: Chapter 38: Jonah
item.description: Jonah refuses to warn the people according to the Lord's directions. He is swallowed by a large fish. He repents and declares repentance unto the people of Nineveh.

item.title: Chapter 39: The Israelites Are Captured
item.description: Wicked kings rule in Jerusalem. Prophets warn the people, but they do not listen. Babylon conquers them.

item.title: Chapter 40: Daniel and His Friends
item.description: Daniel and his friends obey God and request healthy food instead of meat and wine.

item.title: Chapter 41: Daniel and the King’s Dream
item.description: Daniel interprets the king's dream. The dream means the gospel will be preached all over the world. Daniel becomes leader over all the land.

item.title: Chapter 42: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego
item.description: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego refuse to pray to an idol. The king throws them into a hot furnace, and God saves them.

item.title: Chapter 43: Daniel and the Lions’ Den
item.description: King Darius issues a law to kill all those who pray to God. Daniel continues to pray and is thrown into the lions' den. God saves him from injury.

item.title: Chapter 44: Return to Jerusalem
item.description: The Jews return to Jerusalem and rebuild the temple. Some wicked men try to stop them. The prophets Ezra and Nehemiah give them instructions.

item.title: Chapter 45: Esther
item.description: Esther, a Jew, is chosen as the new queen. Esther saves her people by revealing wicked Haman's plan.

item.title: Chapter 46: Job
item.description: Job is a very righteous man. God knew that Job would remain righteous even if he was tried in all things. Satan could not destroy Job's faith.

item.title: Chapter 47: The Prophets Tell about Jesus
item.description: The prophets preach about Jesus Christ. They tell of His birth, life, death, and resurrection.

item.title: Chapter 48: After the Old Testament
item.description: Many Jews disobey God. Armies from other lands take them captive. Herod becomes the king over the Jews.

item.title: Special Witnesses of Christ
item.description: This one-hour program, features members of the First Presidency and Quorum of the Twelve Apostles of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints bearing personal testimony of the Savior's divine mission.

item.title: Can You Imagine?
item.description: A young man's alter ego uses a courtroom setting to explore what it would be like to stand before God on Judgment Day.

item.title: A Matter of a Few Degrees
item.description: The difference between happiness and misery … often comes down to an error of only a few degrees.

item.title: Freedom to Choose
item.description: “Thou mayest choose for thyself, for it is given unto thee” (Moses 3:17).

item.title: I Will Give Myself to Him
item.description: November 3, 2013: Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe teaches young adults principles of controlling the natural man and giving themselves to the Lord.

item.title: The Gift of a Savior
item.description: Each act of kindness to anyone becomes a kindness to Him because He loves all of Heavenly Father’s children. And because that brings joy to Him, it also brings joy to His Father, to whom we owe thanks beyond measure.

item.title: Seeing Christmas through New Eyes
item.description: We celebrate the birth of the Son of God, the Creator, our Messiah. We rejoice that the King of kings came to earth, was born in a manger, and lived a perfect life.

item.title: Hark! The Herald Angels Sing
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings "Hark! The Herald Angels Sing."

item.title: Chapter 54: Jesus Is Risen
item.description: Jesus rises from the dead. He appears to Mary Magdalene and His Apostles as the resurrected Lord.

item.title: Chapter 53: Jesus Is Crucified
item.description: Jesus suffers on the cross for the sins of the world.

item.title: Chapter 51: Jesus Suffers in the Garden of Gethsemane
item.description: Jesus endures the pain of the sins of the world in the Garden of Gethsemane before He is betrayed by one of His friends.
